page.title: Station Control - Common
page.t: Attention! Station under attack, please prepare to evacuate.
Attention! We have a security system failure. The system will need a few minutes to re-activate.
Attention! We have a power system failure. It will take a few minutes to bring it back online.
(do not translate)Viktigt meddelande: Att prata innan man tänker är som att torka sig i röven utan att ha skitigt.
(do not translate)Viktigt meddelande: Vi har en två pojkar här som heter Matthias och Sebastian som har tappat bort sin farfar Benkt. Pojkarna väntar vid kundservice och kan återfas mot beskrivning.
We would like to remind all visitors to visit our special sales area close to the casino.
Please note that any spaceweed consumption aboard this station is against the law.
Security would like to remind all visitors to keep their belongings with them at all times.
Security would like to remind all visitors to keep their children with them at all times.
If you bring any creatures on board, please make sure they are chained. Any loose animals will be vaporised on sight.
Beggars are operating on this Factory. Please do NOT encourage these professional beggars. If you have any spare credits, please give them to a registered charity.
Incoming ship. Docking crews to standby.
Ladies and Gentlemen, Station Administration would like to remind you to keep children away from the airlocks.
We have reports of an outbreak of Argon flu in this sector. Would all visitors please report to the medic bay for inoculation.
Warning explosive materials can be hazardous. Please contact the dock master if you have any on board.
All Ex-Military Personnel please report to Medbay Six For BioWeapons Clearance.
Attention all departing pilots! Pirates have been seen in the sector. Be careful.
EGOSOFT would like to thank you for buying their product.
The restaurant is now open for anyone wishing to dine before departing the station.
Please remember to return your depleted Energy Cells to the recycling compound.
We would like to remind visitors that dropping litter anywhere other than an approved recycling station carries an automatic 500 credit fine.
Customers are reminded that wares on this station are sold without warranties.
Please check your cargo is secured before departure.
Do not wave at the stations security cameras. Distracted operators lead to undetected crime.
Dear visitors, we are experiencing some minor surges in our power grid. Please excuse any inconveniences.
You are reminded that lottery tickets are available from all retail outlets in this station.
Last call for passengers for flight
Flight engineers, report to docking bay(number)
. Until this inconvenience is resolved this area shall remain off-limits.
Will the pilot of the ship ...(slight pause) ID
, please clear the docking bay. Your docking permit has expired.
Repair crews report to docking bay(number...)
The next shuttle to the planet surface will depart in(number)
is now closed due to a station fire brigade drill. Please bypass this area following the marked routes.
All pilots may be requested to have their cargo bay scanned for contraband.
. All first class passengers please board the shuttle from section(number)
Would the owner of the freight container(number)
(would someone)please report to the customs center. Some clearance papers are missing.
Medical emergency crews report to docking bay(number)
Today there is a sale in the
has been cancelled due to Xenon activities on route. Would all passengers please contact reception

page.title: Argon NPC Male 1 / Antigone rep / Misc Plot Characters
page.descr: Lines for Argon NPC Male 1 and Miscellaneous story characters using that voice
page.t: (Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(variant)(refusal to do something)I'll do no such thing.
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)What? You must be kidding!
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)Never! I'd rather die!
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.
(warning of consequences - opening fire)You are now being targeted.
(warning of consequences - sending ships)Ships are now being dispatched.
(warning of consequences - reporting)You will now be reported to local security forces.
(report of attack - ships)Reporting an attack against this vessel.
(report of attack - stations)Reporting an attack against this station.
(law enforcement confirms report, after something like Affirmative)Criminal record has been updated.
(report of attack generic)Reporting a criminal offence.
(variant)(ship complies to police instructions)Smart move. Don't let us catch you again.
(ship does not comply)You have refused to comply.
(reporting)This is sector security reporting criminal activity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship)Careful. Be on the look out for sector security.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)They found us! What do we do?
(variant)(response to above - rushed suggestion)Drop the cargo, quickly!
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)Something hit us.
(capital or m-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We're taking hits.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They can't withstand our firepower.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They're starting to take serious damage.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Ha! Send no reply!
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Don't let up now - we have them!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Oh my...
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)How much longer?
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)This is starting to get worrying.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)No, no, no, no, no!
(variant)(taunt line - response-capable)You call yourself a pilot?
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Please have mercy!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)No! Please, no!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)Please - we ask you to spare us!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)We're losing the ship! Please, stop!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)Please! Spare my life!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)No more, please! I'm losing the ship!
(pilot bailing from ship)This isn't worth it! Bailing!
(congratulations after combat from captain)Well done, everyone!
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in)We have new attack orders.
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in during target)New attack orders!
(preparing new attack orders)Prepare to open fire on the target.
(preparing new attack orders during combat)Attack this target!
(reaction to friendly fire)Hey, will you stop firing?
(reaction to friendly fire)You're wrecking my shields!
(reaction to friendly fire)Why are you shooting me?
(enemy ship or station exploding)It's going to blow!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)Was that shot some kind of joke?
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)You're not taking me out like that!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)That's fine! I can take one hit!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)You're going to regret that!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)You're making a big mistake!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)Oh, you want some more?!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)You can't withstand our firepower.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)Hold still, I'll make it quick!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)You're gonna get it now!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Oh, I'm shaking.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I'm not afraid of you.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I'm not impressed.
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)Ha! No way!
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)Sorry - I didn't mean to hit you.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - xenon)You have a good aim for a machine.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - silent enemy)I'm not that easy to kill!
(variant)(missile use)I'm going to use missiles to take them out.
(variant)(torpedo use)Let's see how they handle a torpedo.
(variant)(losing an enemy)I'm trying to shake them!
(variant)(losing an enemy)I'll try to shake them off!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)That was pathetic!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)I can handle this easily.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)I haven't even started yet!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)Prepare to be vaporised.
(variant)(NPC attempts bribe)Maybe we can work out a deal.
(variant)(NPC bribe succeeds)I knew we'd be able to work something out.
(variant)(NPC fired)I don't like it, but I respect it.
Last order could not be completed.
(order added to queue - informal)It's been added to the list.
The order might take longer than expected.
Pass on new coordinates to following ships.
Inform me when all ships have arrived.
All ships have arrived at destination.
(command)Tell group leader we've spotted enemy activity.
(relay report)They say it's safe to engage.
(relay report)They say it's too risky to engage.
One of our wingmen is asking for backup.
(escort leaves)You're on your own from here.
(grateful)Might not have made it without you.
(during combat)Get on the line! We need backup, now!
(group of small ships - winning)We're all over them!
(group of small ships - winning)We've got them now!
(group of small ships - losing)They're all over us!
(group of small ships - losing)We can't stand this.
(response to distress call - singular)Hang on! I'm on my way!
(response to distress call - plural)We've received your call. We're on the way.
Please follow directions to designated docking position.
They've marked our docking position for us.
Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.
We're pleased to welcome you aboard.
(Informing player ship will soon undock)The ship will be undocking soon.
(Informing player ship will not undock before they return)I'll wait for you to tell me to take off.
(Informing player they will have to manually tell the pilot to take off)Let me know when you want to take off.
There's a ship preparing to undock.
Departing ship, you are clear to undock. Safe travels.
Bring away from the docking position. Slowly.
Use these criteria for the search.
I've found a trade offer matching our criteria.
Tell that station we are on our way.
(when a repair / upgrade order comes in)Which ship needs the work?
(variant)(fluff - moving from one part of the ship to another)Let's see what we can do over here.
(variant)(fluff - completed upgrade / repair)That just about does it.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. I)I'm just finishing up with my current work.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. II)Got anything else for me?
(order for new units)Let's make an order for new units.
(order for new ammo)Let's make an order for some more ammunition.
(cap ship repair)Ask the station to start repairs.
(cap ship / station repair)Launching repair units now.
(law enforcement respons to comms - followed up by comms greeting)This is sector security.
(ship scan warning - cargo)Please halt. We will be scanning your cargo hold.
(ship scan warning - inventory)Please halt. We will be scanning your inventory.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)You're clean. Move along.
(ship scan result - something found)We've detected contraband.
(ordering to drop cargo/contraband)Release your contraband immediately.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - nothing found)See? I'm just your every-day model citizen.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - something found)Err... I have a permit for that... somewhere.
(variant)(ship scanned - illegal)Hey! You can't do that!
(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)Bet you've got some nice loot.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)Pfft. Empty! What use is that?
(variant)(ship scan result)Ahah! You've got something good there.
(variant)(ordered to drop cargo - releases under duress)Okay! Take the cargo!
(variant)(ordered to surrender ship - surrenders under duress)Okay! Take the ship!
(station / ship sabotaged - explosives)I'm noticing a small breach. It looks like someone used explosives on the hull.
(station / ship sabotaged - EMP)Electronics have gone dead somewhere. Someone used an EMP device.
(station / ship hacked)It looks like someone's hacked us.
(station security saw suspicious activity)We've picked up suspicious activity.
(station security saw suspicious activity - report inside managers office)Security vessels are reporting suspicious activity.
(manager response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Send out additional security vessels.
(manager / captain response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Launch emergency fighters.
Make sure service crew know to fix the damage.
(call to security forces - minor)Look out for any suspicious activity.
(call to security forces - major)Tell us of any suspicious activity immediately.
(call to security forces - search)Scan for suspicious activity.
Look only for our target resource.
(NPC moves onto player's ship)I'm aboard your ship and ready to go.
(NPC moves off player ship)Thanks for the ride. See you around.
(No room on player's ship)You don't have enough room on your ship right now.
(NPC wants to leave ship)Drop me off at the nearest station.
(Player receives licence)Congratulations on your new licence.
(greeting - black marketeer - on introduction)(@voice confident but not drawing attention)If you're looking to find some black market merchandise, I'm the one to talk to.
(Friendly greeting)It's good to see you, friend.
(Allied greeting)It's an honour to see you here.
(Promotion ceremony - intro)It is good of you to come in person.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, friendly)We've been watching your work with great interest, and wanted to reward you for it.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, allied)We're happy that you've continued to work alongside us, and wanted to reward you for your efforts.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', friendly)I'm pleased to present you with a new rank amongst our organisation.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', allied)It's an honour to present you with a new rank amongst our organisation.
(Promotion ceremony)Of course, this rank comes with great benefits.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)These benefits are tied to the rank, so if you lose the rank, the benefits go too.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)But with your record, I'm sure we don't have to worry about that.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)I hope you find these rewards fitting to the work you've done, and make the most of them.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)Oh, and you may also find that certain organisations under our jurisdiction now have interest in you joining their ranks.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)Once again, I thank you for your efforts.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)We look forward to working with you more in the future.
(Start of greeting)On behalf of our organisation: (keep space)
We need to damage the target further.
(to marine)Alright, get out of there. Abort.
(boarding pod launched)Pod launched. Moving to target.
(begin breach)We're making our way through the hull.
(marine lost during breach)Man down! Watch out for countermeasures on the hull!
One of the teams is pinned down.
(lots of fighting noise)We're taking heavy losses.
(lots of fighting noise)We're pushing through. Lots of resistance.
We've secured several sections. Moving on.
The commander's dead. We're getting hammered in here!
I have a team working on bypassing a lockdown.
The crew seems to be abandoning ship.
The self-destruct has been activated. We're working on disabling it.
I don't think we can make it to the bridge. Requesting abort.
I'm calling it. Abort! Get back to your pods!
(self-destruct imminent, somber)Sorry, Sir. This isn't looking good.
(target damaged)Don't destroy the target while we're in here!

Even after everything that has struck over the last few decades, the Terran Conflict, the Xenon and the Jump Gate shutdown, the Argon Federation has established itself as a key power in this new Jump Gate network, and even its most distant colony, Black Hole Sun, is a hub of trade and community. Opportunities are aplenty for all. Every day, scores of young pilots set out from the system for the first time, on their way to find adventure among the stars.

Val Selton's log. Day 1. I'm excited to get underway with this new ship. I'm not entirely sure what I'll do yet - trading, exploring, am I brave enough to face combat? Whatever it is, I'm sure it'll be exciting. Here goes nothing.
(emergency event mission offer)I could really use some help right now.
(data leak signal - illegal opportunity)I'm taking a big risk by broadcasting, so if you decode this transmission, keep it to yourself. I have work that needs doing.
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone hear me?! Hello?! I'm not supposed to be broadcasting but I need help! Please! I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone here me?! I need help! Please, if you can hear this, I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help)Hey! I know this is unconventional, but if you can hear this, I could use some help.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Don't let them get away!
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal cargo on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal wares on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal data on drone detected.
(player looks at offer - generic)Are you interested in a job?
(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)Have you heard about this next raid? Sounds like a good opportunity to get rich.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)Yeah, I hope so. Haven't had much luck recently so we're due a change in fortune.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I need to move this stuff! Are you interested in buying it or not?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)Sure, I guess. I'll be at my usual spot on station - meet me there quickly.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)I dropped the package in a lockbox nearby. These are the coordinates.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I can't go right now, but I'll be able to pick it up soon.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.
(* Argon Vs Holy Order War Missions *)
It's my job to coordinate our efforts against the Holy Order, not only with the Argon Navy but also volunteer freelance pilots, such as yourself.
If you're here, you must have been recognised as a true friend of the Argon Federation.
If you're here, you must have been recognised as an outstanding citizen of the Argon Federation.
The Federation is in great need for pilots like you.
While we are always under constant threat of Xenon incursions, the Holy Order situation itself has become a challenging and complex conflict.
As such, we will require any potential recruits to undergo a probation period.
And no, it isn't because you're a Paranid yourself.
The last thing we need is some screw-up turning each and every Paranid against us because they fired on a Godrealm ship by mistake. You don't strike me as a screw-up, so why don't we get started?
There will be a wide range of tasks, from combat deployments to construction work. Depending on the situation, you will have a selection of tasks to choose from.
You will be paid as you complete your allotted tasks, with a potential bonus at the end.
As a Paranid, I expect you know the nuances better than us, but I'll give our take on it.

It's essentially a Paranid civil war. While the Gates were shut down, several Paranid factions found themselves without their leader, the Pontifex Maximus. So, what do you do when you have no leadership? You panic and hatch a new one.

That worked fine until the Gates re-connected and each faction pushed their own Pontifex as the one true king. Now, there are only two Pontifices left; that we know of. The one of the Godrealm and the one of the Holy Order.
It's true that the Federation and the Godrealm haven't always seen eye to eye, but we're on friendly terms right now.

That rubs the Holy Order the wrong way, primarily because they appear to be considerably more xenophobic. And given how they oppose the Godrealm as a whole, they like to highlight our current relations as a weakness.
Along with the Antigone Republic, we've managed to drive off the majority of their pushes into our space.
Alright. I'll have a suitable task picked out for you momentarily.
You will now find tasks related to the Holy Order conflict in your mission interface.
There are currently no open tasks.
Sorry, but that is a very sensitive situation. We require pilots who have proven themselves to the Argon Federation.
Sorry. We're still reviewing your performance from the last time.
This is a joint mission with the God Realm of the Paranid, so please bring your best.
Unfortunately, your current standing with us does not allow you to take part in our operations.
Your performance during your assignments is frankly below the standards we set for pilots of the Argon Navy.
You are welcome to re-apply later, should you get the chance.
This is a call from the Argon Federation to all willing and able pilots to aid us in defending our space from the Holy Order.
The God Realm of the Paranid are also involved, making this a very sensitive situation which requires a level head.
Our goals are to protect our borders and prevent escalation of this conflict. If you think you're up to the task, sign up!
(briefing status - optimistic)Our recent efforts in the conflict against the Holy Order are going as planned.
(briefing status - optimistic)The ongoing conflict against the Holy Order of the Pontifex continues to fall in our favour.
(briefing status - optimistic)There have recently been great signs of progress in our war against the Holy Order.
(briefing status - optimistic)We've made good ground in our fight against the Holy Order recently. May that continue going forwards.
(briefing status - optimistic)The Holy Order of the Pontifex has not been able to stand to our recent efforts against them.
(briefing status - optimistic)We are continuing to make good progress in our war with the Holy Order.
(briefing status - pessimistic)Our recent efforts in this war have been rather hampered by the Holy Order of the Pontifex.
(briefing status - pessimistic)Honestly, our war against the Holy Order is not currently looking good for our side.
(briefing status - pessimistic)In our fight against the Holy Order of the Pontifex, the tide is currently against us.
(briefing status - pessimistic)We've lost serious ground in our fight against the Holy Order recently. We must look to change this.
(briefing status - pessimistic)The Holy Order of the Pontifex has made good ground against us in our ongoing conflict.
(briefing status - pessimistic)Our recent efforts against the Holy Order of the Pontifex have struggled to make an impact.
(briefing status - instruction)Take a look at these instructions and decide where you can best assist.
(briefing status - instruction)Look at these instructions and pick a task that best suits your abilities.
(briefing status - instruction)Look through what needs doing; decide what suits you best.
(briefing status - instruction)Take a look at these directives before deciding how you can help us.
(briefing status - instruction)Look through our current objectives and pick an area in which you can aid us.
(briefing status - thanks)Thank you for your help in this conflict.
(briefing status - thanks)The Argon Federation thanks you for your help.
(briefing status - thanks)Thank you. I'm sure the Holy Order won't know what's hit them.

page.t: (Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(variant)(refusal to do something)Sorry, I won't do that.
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)Really? No!
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)Not in this lifetime!
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.

(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)We've been spotted. What now?
(variant)(response to above - rushed suggestion)Just drop the cargo as quickly as you can.
(variant)(ship complies to pirate instructions)Nice and easy, just how I like it.
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.

(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They can't take much more of this!
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)Their defences are weakening.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.

(variant)(retaliation)That, my friend, was not a good idea.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Uhoh, that's not good.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)I don't want to be here!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)I just want to get home in one piece!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)No! Stop!
(variant)(taunt line - response-capable)An Argnu would stand more chance than you!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Let me be! Please!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Don't do it!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)Please spare our lives!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)There's not much left of our ship. Please stop!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)Please let me live!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)My ship can't take any more. Stop, please!
(pilot bailing from ship)This isn't worth it! Bailing!
(congratulations after combat from captain)Well done, everyone!
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in)We have new attack orders.

(reaction to friendly fire)Hey, will you stop firing?

(reaction to friendly fire)Why are you shooting me?
(enemy ship or station exploding)It's going to blow!

(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)You'll have to do better than that!
(variant)(enemy destroyed - taunt)One more for my score-sheet!
(variant)(enemy destroyed - report)The target has been destroyed!

(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)That was not smart!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)So you want some more then, do you?
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)You cannot possibly win against our firepower.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)Let's finish this off nice and quickly!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)You won't last long now!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)You talk big, but can you deliver?
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)You don't bother me.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Is that all you've got?
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)I don't think so!
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)Oops, I didn't mean to hit you.

(variant)(losing an enemy)I need to get clear!

Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.
We're pleased to welcome you aboard.

There's a ship preparing to undock.
Departing ship, you are clear to undock. Safe travels.
Bring away from the docking position. Slowly.
Use these criteria for the search.
I've found a trade offer matching our criteria.
Tell that station we are on our way.

(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)So, what's in the cargo hold?

(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)I'm in! I could really do with the credits.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)This stuff is burning a hole in my cargo hold. Would you like to buy it?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)I'll take it. Meet me over in my usual place on the station.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)The stuff is all in a lockbox. It's at these coordinates, not far away.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I've just got a couple of other things to do, but I'll pick it up soon.

Greetings pilot. I represent the Antigone Trade Guild and I've been told to present you with the opportunity to become a member.
If you're interested, come find me.
Ah, I'm glad you came. Our guild is currently seeking to increase our presence in the market.
To compete with the Teladi, we're offering membership to a select number of trusted individuals.
This is a one-time investment, after which you will have access to a number of job listings.
As you can expect, most jobs will involve shifting wares between stations but we're also looking for combat pilots.
We have to protect our interests and seek out new opportunities. I believe you can help us do that.
It's a competitive market and we need skilled partners. You just so happened to catch our attention.
(reject)Sorry. You'll need to become a member of our guild first.
Great. I'll update our database right away. You should now be able to see jobs on offer in the areas where we operate.
We expect good things from you.
Sorry, it appears you don't have the necessary funds available.

The Jump Gate shutdown is now defined as the single most important event in the history of the network. A disaster of cataclysmic proportion that changed everything, redefining our very way of life. Despite all of the odds, however, we have come through the other side, and along the way have found more to research and explore than ever before. That is the area in which we pride ourselves. The Alliance of the Word. Founded on the idea that those disconnected from the Jump Gate network could be saved, we strive to find out more, for the good of all of us.

This is where you come in, pilot. You are are member of our team of explorers now, and we're depending on you to find out whatever you can about this strange, new Jump Gate network; its mysteries, its secrets. Good luck, pilot.

(Promotion ceremony - intro)It's good that you came in person.

(Promotion ceremony - cntd, allied)We're happy that you've continued to walk alongside us, and we would like to reward you for your efforts.

(Promotion ceremony)Of course, this rank comes with a number of benefits.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)These benefits are tied to the rank, so if you lose the rank, the benefits go too.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)But with your record, I'm sure we don't have to worry about that.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)These rewards befit the work you've done. Make the most of them.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)Oh, and you may also find that certain organisations within our community now have interest in you joining their ranks.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)Once again, I thank you for your efforts.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)We look forward to your future accomplishments.

page.t: (Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.

The request came from a police vessel.

(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)You're joking, right?
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)I won't be giving up any time soon.
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.
(warning of consequences - opening fire)You are now being targeted.
(warning of consequences - sending ships)Ships are now being dispatched.
(warning of consequences - reporting)You will now be reported to local security forces.
(report of attack - ships)Reporting an attack against this vessel.
(report of attack - stations)Reporting an attack against this station.
(law enforcement confirms report, after something like Affirmative)Criminal record has been updated.
(report of attack generic)Reporting a criminal offence.
(variant)(ship complies to police instructions)That was the right thing to do, pilot.
(ship does not comply)You have refused to comply.
(reporting)This is sector security reporting criminal activity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship)Careful! Sector security will probably be on patrol.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)Security ships have found us. What now?
(variant)(response to above - rushed suggestion)Er... just drop the cargo!
(variant)(ship complies to pirate instructions)Easy as Argnu pie!
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)Something hit us.
(capital or m-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We're taking hits.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They won't hold out much longer against us.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)Looks like they are taking some serious damage now.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)We're nearly there!
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Don't stop now.
(variant)(retaliation)Looking for a fight are you? OK then!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)This is bad!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)I want to go home.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)I can't take much more of this!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Argh! Stop!
(variant)(taunt line - response-capable)Try talking less. You might fly better.
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Oh no! Please!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)Show mercy on us, please.
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)We can't take any more. Please stop.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)Please, let me live!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)My ships's done for. I don't want to die!
(pilot bailing from ship)This isn't worth it! Bailing!
(congratulations after combat from captain)Well done, everyone!
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in)We have new attack orders.
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in during target)New attack orders!
(preparing new attack orders)Prepare to open fire on the target.
(preparing new attack orders during combat)Attack this target!
(reaction to friendly fire)Hey, will you stop firing?
(reaction to friendly fire)You're wrecking my shields!
(reaction to friendly fire)Why are you shooting me?
(enemy ship or station exploding)It's going to blow!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)Was that the best you could do?
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)One hit like that isn't going to stop me!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)Try harder next time!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)I won't let you get away with that!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)Bad move, pilot!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)More? Coming right up!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)You're seriously under-equipped to deal with us!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)I'll try and make it quick!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)You're done for now!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)That's really not scary.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Big words, pilot.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I'm not frightened of you!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Not impressed, sorry!
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)No way!
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)I didn't mean to do that, sorry!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - xenon)I can't believe I let myself get hit by a machine!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - silent enemy)That's just not good enough.
(variant)(missile use)I'm going to need missiles for this job.
(variant)(losing an enemy)I need to get them off my tail!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)Did that even hit? Oh, it did, just.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)Terrible shot!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)I'm just getting started!
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)Hope you're ready to be destroyed!
(variant)(NPC attempts bribe)Could we come to some sort of deal?
(variant)(NPC hired)You won't regret this. I'll work hard for you.
(variant)(NPC fired)I see. I guess it's goodbye then.
Last order could not be completed.
(order added to queue - informal)It's been added to the list.
The order might take longer than expected.
Pass on new coordinates to following ships.
Inform me when all ships have arrived.
All ships have arrived at destination.
(command)Tell group leader we've spotted enemy activity.
(relay report)They say it's safe to engage.
(relay report)They say it's too risky to engage.
One of our wingmen is asking for backup.
(escort leaves)You're on your own from here.
(grateful)Might not have made it without you.
(during combat)Get on the line! We need backup, now!
(group of small ships - winning)We're all over them!
(group of small ships - winning)We've got them now!
(group of small ships - losing)They're all over us!
(group of small ships - losing)We can't stand this.
(response to distress call - singular)Hang on! I'm on my way!
(response to distress call - plural)We've received your call. We're on the way.
Please follow directions to designated docking position.
They've marked our docking position for us.
Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.
We're pleased to welcome you aboard.
(Informing player ship will soon undock)The ship will be undocking soon.
(Informing player ship will not undock before they return)I'll wait for you to tell me to take off.
(Informing player they will have to manually tell the pilot to take off)Let me know when you want to take off.
There's a ship preparing to undock.
Departing ship, you are clear to undock. Safe travels.
Bring away from the docking position. Slowly.
Use these criteria for the search.
I've found a trade offer matching our criteria.
Tell that station we are on our way.
(when a repair / upgrade order comes in)Which ship needs the work?
(variant)(fluff - moving from one part of the ship to another)I'm sure I put it down somewhere over here.
(variant)(fluff - finished repair)Fixed and ready to go!
(variant)(fluff - completed upgrade / repair)That's a big improvement.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. I)Nearly done. I won't be long.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. II)What's next on the list?
(order for new units)Let's make an order for new units.
(order for new ammo)Let's make an order for some more ammunition.
(cap ship repair)Ask the station to start repairs.
(cap ship / station repair)Launching repair units now.
(law enforcement respons to comms - followed up by comms greeting)This is sector security.
(ship scan warning - cargo)Please halt. We will be scanning your cargo hold.
(ship scan warning - inventory)Please halt. We will be scanning your inventory.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)You can go. The scan came back clean.
(ship scan result - something found)We've detected contraband.
(ordering to drop cargo/contraband)Release your contraband immediately.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - compliant)Sure, scan any time.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - nothing found)No surprise there!
(variant)(ship scanned by police - something found)I don't remember putting that in my cargo bay!
(variant)(ship scanned - illegal)Hey! You're not allowed to do that!
(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)Let's see what we have here.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)What? It's empty!
(variant)(ship scan result)Ohhh! So nice of you to share this with me.
(variant)(ordered to drop cargo - releases under duress)Just take the cargo.
(variant)(ordered to surrender ship - surrenders under duress)What am I supposed to do without a ship?
(station / ship sabotaged - explosives)I'm noticing a small breach. It looks like someone used explosives on the hull.
(station / ship sabotaged - EMP)Electronics have gone dead somewhere. Someone used an EMP device.
(station / ship hacked)It looks like someone's hacked us.
(station security saw suspicious activity)We've picked up suspicious activity.
(station security saw suspicious activity - report inside managers office)Security vessels are reporting suspicious activity.
(manager response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Send out additional security vessels.
(manager / captain response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Launch emergency fighters.
Make sure service crew know to fix the damage.
(call to security forces - minor)Look out for any suspicious activity.
(call to security forces - major)Tell us of any suspicious activity immediately.
(call to security forces - search)Scan for suspicious activity.
Look only for our target resource.
(NPC moves onto player's ship)I'm aboard your ship and ready to go.
(NPC moves off player ship)Thanks for the ride. See you around.
(No room on player's ship)You don't have enough room on your ship right now.
(NPC wants to leave ship)Drop me off at the nearest station.
(Player receives licence)Congratulations on your new licence.
(greeting - black marketeer - on introduction)(@voice confident but not drawing attention)If you're looking to find some black market merchandise, I'm the one to talk to.
(Friendly greeting)It's good to see you, friend.
(Allied greeting)It's an honour to see you here.
(Start of greeting)On behalf of our organisation: (keep space)
We need to damage the target further.
(to marine)Alright, get out of there. Abort.
(boarding pod launched)Pod launched. Moving to target.
(begin breach)We're making our way through the hull.
(marine lost during breach)Man down! Watch out for countermeasures on the hull!
One of the teams is pinned down.
(lots of fighting noise)We're taking heavy losses.
(lots of fighting noise)We're pushing through. Lots of resistance.
We've secured several sections. Moving on.
The commander's dead. We're getting hammered in here!
I have a team working on bypassing a lockdown.
The crew seems to be abandoning ship.
The self-destruct has been activated. We're working on disabling it.
I don't think we can make it to the bridge. Requesting abort.
I'm calling it. Abort! Get back to your pods!
(self-destruct imminent, somber)Sorry, Sir. This isn't looking good.
(target damaged)Don't destroy the target while we're in here!
(emergency event mission offer)I could really use some help right now.
(data leak signal - illegal opportunity)I'm taking a big risk by broadcasting, so if you decode this transmission, keep it to yourself. I have work that needs doing.
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone hear me?! Hello?! I'm not supposed to be broadcasting but I need help! Please! I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone here me?! I need help! Please, if you can hear this, I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help)Hey! I know this is unconventional, but if you can hear this, I could use some help.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Don't let them get away!
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal cargo on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal wares on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal data on drone detected.
(player looks at offer - generic)Are you interested in a job?
(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)We're preparing for another operation. Are you going to join us?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)Yes, I'd like to join you. I could do with some fun!
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I really need to move this stuff soon. Would you be able to buy it from me?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)I'll take it. I'll see you at my usual place on this station, OK?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)There's a lockbox nearby. All the stuff is in it. I'll give you the coordinates.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I'll head over and pick it up as soon as I can.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.
