(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)How would you feel about joining us on the raid we've got coming up?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)Sounds good! I hope you've picked a nice juicy target.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I can't keep this stuff much longer. Can you take it off my hands?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)I think I could manage that. I'll see you over in my usual place.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)I've put everything in a lockbox. These are the coordinates.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)It'll have to wait until I've finished up here, but I'll go and collect it right after that.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.
My job here is to help coordinate our efforts against the Xenon and given the threat, we're in need of as many volunteers as we can get.
If you're here, it means you have been recognised as a true friend of the Argon Federation.
If you're here, it means you have been recognised as an outstanding citizen of the Argon Federation.
There is a great need for pilots like you.
The Xenon have been a constant threat throughout our history. Many see them as a force of nature, something we have to weather and survive, but the reality is, this is a war.
We can't just throw every passing pilot at the enemy. Any potential recruits will undergo a probation period.
Looking at your records, I see you consider yourself a 'Xenon Slayer'. Good for you, but that won't help you cut corners.
Each engagement needs to be a victory or they'll overrun us. I'm sure you knew that or you wouldn't be here. Let's get started.
There will be a wide range of tasks, from combat deployments to construction work. Depending on the situation, you will have a selection of tasks to choose from.
You will be paid as you complete your allotted tasks, with a potential bonus at the end.
As someone who's been toe to toe with the Xenon I'm sure you know what they are capable of.
The Xenon are a 'race' of intelligent, replicating machines and they have been a looming threat throughout our history.
They were originally created to help the Terrans explore the stars and terraform worlds but trying to control Artificial General Intelligence proved costly.
And now, hundreds of years later, we're still trying to clean up their mistake but we have no idea how far they have spread throughout the universe.
All we can do is hold out and prevent them from spreading any further. Every other government, allied or not, is faced with the Xenon threat. It's about the only thing we can all agree on.
We've even had temporary ceasefires with the Holy Order when faced with a Xenon attack. Quite temporary though.
Alright. I'll have a suitable task picked out for you momentarily.
You will now find tasks related to the Xenon in your mission interface.
There are currently no open tasks.
Sorry, but this is a high-risk situation. We require pilots who have proven themselves to the Argon Federation.
Sorry. We're still reviewing your performance from the last time.
This is a joint mission with the a number of allies, so please bring your best.
Unfortunately, your current standing with us does not allow you to take part in our operations.
Your performance during your last assignment was frankly below the standards we set for pilots of the Argon Navy.
You are welcome to re-apply later, should you get the chance.
This is a call from the Argon Federation to all willing and able pilots to aid us in defending our space from the Xenon.
This is going to be a major operation, so check your fire, and keep a level head.
Our goals are to protect our borders and prevent any Xenon expansion. If you think you're up to the task, sign up!
(briefing status - optimistic)Our recent efforts against the Xenon are going as planned.
(briefing status - optimistic)After several recent encounters with the Xenon, we're confident in saying we came out on top.
(briefing status - optimistic)Due to our efforts, Xenon activity has been greatly reduced throughout our space.
(briefing status - optimistic)We've made good ground in our struggle against the Xenon. They're on the back-foot.
(briefing status - optimistic)The Xenon have lost a number of engagements, giving us a bit of breathing room.
(briefing status - optimistic)Even the Xenon must feel some form of embarrassment after those recent engagements. We're pushing on.
(briefing status - pessimistic)Our recent efforts against the Xenon have suffered due to our conflict with the Holy Order.
(briefing status - pessimistic)We are currently on the back-foot in regards to the Xenon.
(briefing status - pessimistic)The Xenon are pushing against us and are making up ground. We're reevaluating our position.
(briefing status - pessimistic)We've lost serious ground to the Xenon recently. We are considering alternative strategies.
(briefing status - pessimistic)As you may have seen, Xenon activity is on the rise and we are struggling to hold them back.
(briefing status - pessimistic)Our recent efforts against the Xenon have not made much of an impact.
(briefing status - instruction)Take a look at these instructions and decide where you can best assist.
(briefing status - instruction)Look at these instructions and pick a task that best suits your abilities.
(briefing status - instruction)Look through what needs doing; decide what suits you best.
(briefing status - instruction)Take a look at these directives before deciding how you can help us.
(briefing status - instruction)Look through our current objectives and pick an area in which you can aid us.
(briefing status - thanks)Thank you for your help in this conflict.
(briefing status - thanks)The Argon Federation thanks you for your help.
(briefing status - thanks)Thank you. I'm sure the Xenon won't know what's hit them.

page.title: Boron NPC 1 / Boron rep / Misc Plot Characters
page.descr: Lines for Boron NPC 1 and Miscellaneous story characters using that voice
page.t: (Metadata, do not translate)[boron] male female basic
(Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(variant)(refusal to do something)Hm, no, I don't think I'll do that.
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)That's quite an amusing suggestion.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)No, no, I'm not going to surrender.
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.
(warning of consequences - opening fire)You are now being targeted.
(warning of consequences - sending ships)Ships are now being dispatched.
(warning of consequences - reporting)You will now be reported to local security forces.
(report of attack - ships)Reporting an attack against this vessel.
(report of attack - stations)Reporting an attack against this station.
(law enforcement confirms report, after something like Affirmative)Criminal record has been updated.
(report of attack generic)Reporting a criminal offence.
(variant)(ship complies to police instructions)That was very sensible of you, pilot. Very sensible.
(ship does not comply)You have refused to comply.
(reporting)This is sector security reporting criminal activity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship)I'm sure that sector security will be on the lookout. Do take good care.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)Oh dear. I think they might be on to us.
(variant)(response to above - rushed suggestion)You'd better drop the cargo.
(variant)(ship complies to pirate instructions)Oh, that's very cooperative of you.
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)Something hit us.
(capital or m-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We're taking hits.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)It looks like they're really weakening now.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)Their ship seems to be crumbling around them, poor souls.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)We really can't afford to listen to their pleas.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Sadly, I think we have to just carry on.
(variant)(retaliation)You leave me no option but to retaliate.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Oh dear me!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)I'd really rather be somewhere else!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)What a terrible situation!
(variant)(taunt line - response-capable)Goodness! I think I might actually be a better pilot than you!
(variant)(taunt line - response-capable)We Boron are able to defend ourselves, you know.
(variant)(taunt line - generic)This is going better than expected!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Oh no! Please stop, I beg you!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Please, stop shooting! I really don't want to die.
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)On behalf of my whole crew, I ask you to have mercy on us.
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)Our ship is leaking badly. Please have mercy and let us live!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)I'm done for! Please, please spare me!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)I really can't take any more of this. Stop now, please!
(fleeing from combat)This is too much! I must flee!
(pilot bailing from ship)Spare my life! I am leaving my ship!
(relief line)It is wonderful to have survived.
(congratulations after combat from captain)Well done, everyone!
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in)We have new attack orders.
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in during target)New attack orders!
(preparing new attack orders)Prepare to open fire on the target.
(preparing new attack orders during combat)Attack this target!
(reaction to friendly fire)Hey, will you stop firing?
(reaction to friendly fire)You're wrecking my shields!
(reaction to friendly fire)Why are you shooting me?
(enemy ship or station exploding)It's going to blow!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)I've been hit, but I'm not in any danger at the moment.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)Luckily that wasn't the best shot.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)I'm all right... yes, I'm definitely all right.
(variant)(enemy destroyed - taunt)You are at peace now.
(variant)(enemy destroyed - report)The target has been... destroyed.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)I'm afraid I can't just let you get away with that.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)You really shouldn't have done that, you know.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)I can do it again, you know.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)I don't think that was very wise of you.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)I'll try to make it as painless as I can.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)I'm sorry to say this, but I think you're going to die!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I may be Boron, but I'm not afraid to fight!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Don't threaten me, please.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I think you're trying to intimidate me, aren't you?
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Dear me. Aggressive language like that doesn't impress me.
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)Most certainly not!
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)Oh dear me! I'm really terribly sorry about that.
(variant)(taunt - silent enemy)You really can't be allowed to live.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - xenon)That awful machine should never have been equipped with a weapon.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - silent enemy)Hey! Don't do that!
(variant)(threat)I can fight if I have to!
(variant)(threat)Have you ever seen a Boron do this?
(variant)(missile use)What else have we got? Hm... oh, missiles!
(variant)(torpedo use)It seems that I might have to use a torpedo.
(variant)(losing an enemy)I really do need to stop them from following me!
(variant)(losing an enemy)I need to get away from this?
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)Uhoh! I need to check... ah, good, I'm fine.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)Oh gosh! I think everything's still working.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)I haven't finished yet.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)You will be destroyed if you carry on like that, you know.
(variant)(NPC attempts bribe)Perhaps... perhaps you would like to make a little deal?
(variant)(NPC bribe fails)I see. Well never mind.
(variant)(NPC hired)That's very generous of you. I look forward to working with you.
(variant)(NPC fired)Very well. I wish you fair seas.
Last order could not be completed.
(order added to queue - informal)It's been added to the list.
The order might take longer than expected.
Pass on new coordinates to following ships.
Inform me when all ships have arrived.
All ships have arrived at destination.
(command)Tell group leader we've spotted enemy activity.
(relay report)They say it's safe to engage.
(relay report)They say it's too risky to engage.
One of our wingmen is asking for backup.
(escort leaves)You're on your own from here.
(grateful)Might not have made it without you.
(during combat)Get on the line! We need backup, now!
(group of small ships - winning)We're all over them!
(group of small ships - winning)We've got them now!
(group of small ships - losing)They're all over us!
(group of small ships - losing)We can't stand this.
(response to distress call - singular)Hang on! I'm on my way!
(response to distress call - plural)We've received your call. We're on the way.
Please follow directions to designated docking position.
They've marked our docking position for us.
Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.
We're pleased to welcome you aboard.
(Informing player ship will soon undock)The ship will be undocking soon.
(Informing player ship will not undock before they return)I'll wait for you to tell me to take off.
(Informing player they will have to manually tell the pilot to take off)Let me know when you want to take off.
There's a ship preparing to undock.
Departing ship, you are clear to undock. Safe travels.
Bring away from the docking position. Slowly.
Use these criteria for the search.
I've found a trade offer matching our criteria.
Tell that station we are on our way.
(when a repair / upgrade order comes in)Which ship needs the work?
(variant)(fluff - moving from one part of the ship to another)I'm sure... no, or maybe... here?
(variant)(fluff - finished repair)That's better now. I'm happy with that.
(variant)(fluff - completed upgrade / repair)Ah, that's so much better. A real improvement.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. I)Give me a moment or two please. I'll be with you shortly.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. II)There we are. All done. What can I do for you now?
(order for new units)Let's make an order for new units.
(order for new ammo)Let's make an order for some more ammunition.
(cap ship repair)Ask the station to start repairs.
(cap ship / station repair)Launching repair units now.
(law enforcement respons to comms - followed up by comms greeting)This is sector security.
(ship scan warning - cargo)Please halt. We will be scanning your cargo hold.
(ship scan warning - inventory)Please halt. We will be scanning your inventory.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)The scan showed nothing unexpected. Thank you for your time.
(ship scan result - something found)We've detected contraband.
(ordering to drop cargo/contraband)Release your contraband immediately.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - compliant)Oh yes, scan whenever you like.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - nothing found)That's good to hear. I hope the rest of your day is as peaceful.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - something found)I... oh dear... I really don't know what to say.
(variant)(ship scanned - illegal)But... you can't do that!
(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)What do we have here then?
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)An empty cargo bay. That's a little disappointing.
(variant)(ship scan result)I'm afraid I might have to take some of this.
(variant)(ordered to drop cargo - releases under duress)Take my cargo, but please leave me in peace.
(variant)(ordered to surrender ship - surrenders under duress)I'll give you my ship if you let me live!
(station / ship sabotaged - explosives)I'm noticing a small breach. It looks like someone used explosives on the hull.
(station / ship sabotaged - EMP)Electronics have gone dead somewhere. Someone used an EMP device.
(station / ship hacked)It looks like someone's hacked us.
(station security saw suspicious activity)We've picked up suspicious activity.
(station security saw suspicious activity - report inside managers office)Security vessels are reporting suspicious activity.
(manager response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Send out additional security vessels.
(manager / captain response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Launch emergency fighters.
Make sure service crew know to fix the damage.
(call to security forces - minor)Look out for any suspicious activity.
(call to security forces - major)Tell us of any suspicious activity immediately.
(call to security forces - search)Scan for suspicious activity.
Look only for our target resource.
(NPC moves onto player's ship)I'm aboard your ship and ready to go.
(NPC moves off player ship)That was a pleasant journey. I thank you.
(No room on player's ship)You don't have enough room on your ship right now.
(NPC wants to leave ship)Drop me off at the nearest station.
(Player receives licence)Congratulations on your new licence.
(greeting - black marketeer - on introduction)(@voice confident but not drawing attention)If you're looking to find some black market merchandise, I'm the one to talk to.
(Friendly greeting)It's good to see you, friend.
(Allied greeting)It's an honour to see you here.
(Promotion ceremony - intro)We are glad that you came in person.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, friendly)We have been watching your accomplishments with great interest, and believe you deserve a reward for it.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, allied)We are elated that you've continued to be a staunch defender of the Queen. You deserve the utmost respect and recognition.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', friendly)I'm pleased to present you with a new rank within the Queendom.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', allied)It's an honour to present you with a new rank within the Queendom.
(Promotion ceremony)You will find that this rank comes with wonderous benefits.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)These benefits are tied to the rank, so if you lose the rank, the benefits will go too.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)But with your character, I'm sure we have nothing to worry about.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)I hope you find these rewards acceptable. Please, make the most of them.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)You may now find that certain organisations within the Boron Queendom will take interest in you joining their ranks.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)Once again, I thank you for your continued efforts.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)We look forward to working with you more in the future.
(Start of greeting)On behalf of our organisation: (keep space)
We need to damage the target further.
(to marine)Alright, get out of there. Abort.
(on failure, somber)May the waters take you.
(boarding pod launched)Pod launched. Moving to target.
(begin breach)We're making our way through the hull.
(marine lost during breach)Man down! Watch out for countermeasures on the hull!
One of the teams is pinned down.
(lots of fighting noise)We're taking heavy losses.
(lots of fighting noise)We're pushing through. Lots of resistance.
We've secured several sections. Moving on.
We have lost the commander! We are being overrun!
I have a team working on bypassing a lockdown.
The crew seems to be abandoning ship.
The self-destruct has been activated. We're working on disabling it.
I don't think we can make it to the bridge. Requesting abort.
I'm calling it. Abort! Get back to your pods!
(self-destruct imminent, somber)Sorry, Sir. This isn't looking good.
(target damaged)Don't destroy the target while we're in here!
(emergency event mission offer)I could really use some help right now.
(data leak signal - illegal opportunity)I'm taking a big risk by broadcasting, so if you decode this transmission, keep it to yourself. I have work that needs doing.
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone hear me?! Hello?! I'm not supposed to be broadcasting but I need help! Please! I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone here me?! I need help! Please, if you can hear this, I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help)Hey! I know this is unconventional, but if you can hear this, I could use some help.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Don't let them get away!
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal cargo on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal wares on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal data on drone detected.
(player looks at offer - generic)Are you interested in a job?
(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)We have a small... operation planned. It would be nice if you could join us.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)Ah yes, I would very much like to come along.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I really must sell these things. Do you think you could possibly buy them?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)Yes, I can buy them. Let's make the arrangements at my usual place on the station.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)It's all in a lockbox not too far away. These coordinates should help you find it.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I'll go and collect it as soon as I possibly can.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.
...I seem to be broadcasting... Can nobody hear this? Hello? Hmm, maybe if I... Yes, that should be better. Hello, anyone?
I'm in a rather unfortunate situation. Is anyone able to help me? My work is quite time-critical, so if you can, please contact me soon.
Ah, that should do it. I had to disable my voice filter. I was beginning to think my messages were being intercepted by those Split fellows. I'm a little disappointed that it was this easy.
I don't suppose they sent you did they? Oh, that would be quite devious.
Hmm, what should I call them. I suppose captors is quite apt. Employers? They let me work on my own projects some days you see.

Ah, yes. You see, I'm in a spot of bother. I am in the middle of some important scientific research which I'm unable to pursue personally from my current location. I'm looking for an assistant to aid me.

I see. I expected a more positive response to a mysterious distress call with mention of science. Hmm, perhaps I'll describe it as 'exciting' or 'stimulating' next time for a better outcome. Oh, you're still there? Thank you for your time.
I'll send the task to your ship computer. This is rather exciting!
Wonderful! I have managed to place the device on a nearby docking area. You should be getting the coordinates now.
Very good. I see you have found the device. This will allow me to monitor your activity and perform experiments remotely. Please keep it safe.
Oh my. It seems that your pulse is elevated. You must be very excited to take part in this expedition. I'm glad!
I do wonder how my homeworld is faring. It has been such a long time since we have heard news of it.
Should we ever get to meet face to face, I do hope that you can bring me some fresh BoFu. The nuggets the Split give me are more stale than their humour.
Is that BoFu? You remembered! My friend, this makes me so happy!
So, shall we begin? I will attempt to direct you in the best way possible. Please be patient with me.
I don't expect you've spoken to too many Boron before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Boso Ta and it is a pleasure. I do wish it were in person but my current situation is quite precarious.

You must be very curious on what a old lonely Boron is trying to achieve. There are still so many mysteries and unanswered questions. Are Spaceflies sentient? Where are the lost Boron systems? Is faster than light telepathy possible?

It is our task to push the physics of this universe to the breaking point and see if it answers any of those questions! My current employers only seem happy when my research results in novel weapon modifications. Very curious people, those Split.
I do hope they move me to a new tank soon. My tentacles grow weak.
You appear to be getting close to where I detected an anomaly.
I've uploaded new software to your ship systems.
Could you please try using the Long-Range Scanner to search for an anomaly in this vicinity.(for LRS name see {20108,1001} )
Ahha! There it is. If reports are to be believed, these anomalies are tears which may lead to other areas of space, much like the Jump Gates.
So, how adventurous do you feel today? Thanks to my research, I do have a fair idea of where you may end up. Of course, the quickest way to confirm my theory is to put it into practice!
Can you hear me? It took a moment to realign the frequency. It is just as I thought. You have made it through the anomaly and emerged in a distant region.

Your location is actually of great interest to me. Over the years, I have managed to pull sensor logs from passing ships to help further my work. I highlighted this as a prime location for my research, should I ever get the chance.
I'm sorry to interrupt, but it seems that you have arrived at a rather curious location.
I suggest you mark the location of the anomaly on your map.
Oh, it appears you have found another anomaly! How interesting.
Are you having trouble locating the anomaly in the area I have stated? I suggest you use the Long-Range scanner to help find it.
(having trouble getting through the anomaly)Hmm, it does seem quite tricky getting through the anomaly. It appears to require some speed to punch through.
(having trouble getting through the anomaly - joke)It looks like you're trying to enter an anomaly. Would you like help with that?
I don't mean to distract you from your business but do you intend to investigate that anomaly further? My tentacles are tingling in anticipation of the science we will achieve!
While the previous anomaly is interesting, my findings point to something else here which I expect will lead to a ground-breaking discovery. Allow me to guide you to a particular area.
I am currently evaluating what equipment we will need to make the most of this location.

Space here is wounded, with a scar in its fabric which seems to have healed multiple times. There is no record of any abnormal activity at these sites. To everyone else, this is simply an empty area of space.

In my search for signals from long-lost Boron I have detected multiple scars in space which continue to spew a multitude of particles and radiation. In a bustling sector such as this, it would only be seen as background noise. However, some of the noise seems to have artificial form.

We are going to tear this scar wide open and peer inside! Of course, the universe is a fickle thing. One miscalculation and we may well destroy this whole system. Ha! Such stakes make this all the more exciting!
Before we get started, allow me to reimburse you for your help so far. I do hope the Split don't mind me using their credit account to help fund our venture.
Now, the experiment. You will first need to place a satellite around this area in order for us to better understand its nature and how to best provoke the invisible anomaly.

I suggest you also deploy a resource probe so that we can see how the anomaly has affected the local environment. You should be able to acquire these deployable items from stations which offer upgrades.
I know of such a station near your location. I will add the information to your map.
It has been a great many years since I've had such a feeling of freedom. While the Split moved me to several locations as a part of my work, nothing quite beats going on a scientific expedition.
Hmm, no. That satellite is not placed in a favorable position. You can collect it and redeploy if you wish.

Ah, good work. I am receiving a much clearer signal from the tear. Almost immediately, I can see that there are far more gravimetric shears here compared to any other anomaly ever documented. That indicates mass, but of what?
This shows some similarities with a Jump Gate event horizon but there is something else. Could it be a temporal distortion? Perhaps dimensional? Very interesting.
Would you please deploy a resource probe in the specified area, I am curious of this environment.
I see that you have already placed the resource probe in a suitable location. Very good.

You will now be able to see the yields of the resources in the area, should you wish to extract them. As for our research, it seems that nearby objects are covered in exotic particles, possibly spewed from the anomaly.
I hate to be a bother, but I have an idea on how to proceed.

We will need a ship to be flown to a very precise location, near the anomaly. If we fit the ship with the right equipment, we may be able to open the tear wider and have a better idea of what is on the other side.
This will likely end up in the ship's destruction so I will help cover the expense of acquiring a new ship for the task.
Be sure that the ship is evacuated. It's far too early in this experiment for needless casualties.
The ship is in the correct position but is missing some of the required equipment. Please take a look at the details I have provided.
Very good. We seem to be ready for the initial test. I would advise that you clear the area as there are a number of unknowns.
The area must be clear of any obstacles!
(something goes wrong)Well then... I suppose we will have to try again.
I have successfully interfaced with the ship. I am increasing the output of the power-plant while reducing the shielding of the antimatter containers to see if that affects the anomaly.
Wonderful, we are getting a reaction! The ship is beginning to show strain but I will continue to push it further. Keep your distance.
The tear is expanding, it is about to reach the ship! The antimatter will most likely detonate!
Please check your mission briefing for the equipment the ship will need for the experiment.
What is this? Some large artificial structure? So, this is what was on the other side of the tear? It does seem that our investigation has lead to some potentially ground-breaking discovery!

Now my friend, this is where we must proceed with both haste and caution. While I admit, tearing through space-time with an antimatter explosion was far from restrained, we now have something in front of us of untold scientific value. We would be fools to continue carelessly.

For the benefit of the universe, let us hurry and claim our prize before someone can beat us to it! I'll be damned if some passing Teladi junk dealer decides to break it down for spare parts. Or worse yet, the Ministry of Finance Science Division.
I will begin to interface with the structure remotely. Do you mind flying around it so I can make some additional readings.
I'm marking a location of particular interest.
These markings are not quite as 'alien' as I would have expected from such an object. Could this be a top-secret installation? Oh my. I do hope we haven't hijacked some distant Terran station.
It does seem somewhat unfinished, and the materials it is constructed from are quite strange. Even the computer pathways I am navigating are unconventional.
I cannot yet ascertain the function of this asteroid like mass in regards to the rest of the station. Given these readings, it may well be a power source. How interesting.
Ah, progress. It seems that this station is in an emergency state, possibly due to our actions. However, it appears that there is a backdoor protocol to resolve this. Give me a moment.
Wonderful! You see? The station is now under our control. I have access to much of its systems, although some are so alien I will need to take time to investigate them.

There appear to be connection points for additional station modules and they do seem to conform to our standards. If we wish to physically interface with the station without damaging it, I suggest constructing an area to land.
Oh, it appears I must go. My Split employers are approaching and they sound agitated.
I will be in touch when I am able. As I have said, see if you are able to merge their technology with our own by building a dock.
(player under attack)Oh. You seem to be having some issues. I'll call back later.
Have you heard the Split legends regarding the 'Space Duck' of Namek? A creature so majestic it brings even the Split to tears. I heard my captors speaking of it in passing.
(plot as in plot of land)Allow me to cover the cost of the plot licence.
Well done! I have been watching your progress with much interest.
When you dock see if you can access any of the internal structure from an elevator.
Hmm, no. It appears we are still locked out from direct access.
It seems I have no choice. I must leave my current location and join you on that station.
I didn't expect I would need to enact this escape plan so abruptly.
Your help would be greatly appreciated. I will send instructions.
A fast combat ship is preferable.
I must admit, I am beginning to feel a bit tense. I do hope this goes to plan.
I have further refined the plan. Please take a look.
As you can see, I wish to escape the station via a chartered freighter.
There are actually multiple ships involved as to confound anyone wishing to track me.
I would like you to protect any ship which should get into trouble.
Please wait for the ship to conclude its 'business'. It will launch shortly.
Please protect this ship from any harm. While it is a decoy, I would rather no harm comes to the crew.
I am successfully aboard my transport and en-route to the installation.
Oh, that didn't take long at all. It seems that my disappearance has been noticed.
I expect my ship is at a safe distance. I can't say the same for the others. Please be alert.
I am successfully docked. I will begin my work.
My, this structure is far more impressive in person than I expected.
Once the ships are safe, please join me.
When you land, enter the elevator.
Aha! At last, we meet face to face!
This installation is equipped for habitation of all races and this room seems to be some sort of research area.
I expect I could spend years pouring over the data contained in these systems.
I believe we will need help to run this station effectively. You could look to employ a manager.
Come see me when you have a moment. I have made some progress.
Yes, I already have made some progress.
There appears to be several things we can research at this facility.
As you can see, there is much to do.
I personally find mention of this 'Teleportation' irresistible but I leave it to you to decide what we research first.
Please note that these research items have certain requirements.
If you could, please gather the required materials.
I will need some materials to get started.
There are certain requirements for me to start that research.
This research requires certain things to be fulfilled first.
This will allow you to gain blueprints by scanning leaks on certain modules.
This will allow you to craft standard equipment modifications.
This will allow you to construct much improved equipment modifications.
This will allow you to construct superior equipment modifications.
Good choice. I will begin right away.
Very good. I will let you know when I am done.
I look forward to seeing how this turns out.
I expect this will be revolutionary!
I have come to the end of my research
I have concluded my research and the results are astounding.
The results of my research are far beyond my expectations.
It appears some Terran technology was being used to research teleportation over long distances.
I have finished the teleportation research.
I am yet to test it on a lifeform. Given that I am monitoring your lifesigns anyway, perhaps you could do the honours.
I believe I can improve the range of the teleporter with only a miniscule chance of complete cell collapse.
You should find the teleporter now has a much larger range.
You should find the teleporter now has a much larger range.
This seems to be the primary focus of this facility; research into parallel universes. This confirms my theory that we have pulled this object from a universe similar to our own.
I believe this will enable us to send objects to other universes.
I am finally done with the research! You should now be able to construct a module capable of sending objects to other universes.
I see you have made quite the discovery.
I am always in the search of knowledge.
I have added a secondary task to your mission interface.
I must say, I'm glad that we met. I have had so much fun working alongside you.
You will find that new research items available.
Oh, it appears the my former captors have found us.
Do you mind taking care of this? I'm afraid that I'm of little use in this situation.
I will at least activate our defences.
You will do no such thing!
Well. I don't expect they'll be bothering us again.
Well. That was anticlimactic. I'll get back to work.
Please deliver 75,000 microchips for my research.

page.title: Paranid NPC 1 / Paranid rep / Misc Plot Characters
page.descr: Lines for Paranid NPC 1 and Miscellaneous story characters using that voice
page.t: (Metadata, do not translate)[paranid] male female basic
(Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)I laugh at your request.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)I would prefer to die!
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.
(warning of consequences - opening fire)You are now being targeted.
(warning of consequences - sending ships)Ships are now being dispatched.
(warning of consequences - reporting)You will now be reported to local security forces.
(report of attack - ships)Reporting an attack against this vessel.
(report of attack - stations)Reporting an attack against this station.
(law enforcement confirms report, after something like Affirmative)Criminal record has been updated.
(report of attack generic)Reporting a criminal offence.
(variant)(ship complies to police instructions)That was wise, pilot.
(ship does not comply)You have refused to comply.
(reporting)This is sector security reporting criminal activity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship)Be careful. Watch out for security patrols.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)We are detected. What should we do?
(variant)(ship complies to pirate instructions)So easy, as always.
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)Something hit us.
(capital or m-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We're taking hits.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They cannot withstand the might of the Paranid.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They will not last much longer.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Do not respond to their pleas.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Do not relent. Destroy them.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Have mercy!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Save me from this!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Hear my prayers!
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Oh no!
(variant)(taunt line - generic)Your feeble attempts will come to nothing!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Show mercy, please!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)I do not deserve to die!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)We ask that you spare our lives.
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)We are no longer a threat to you. Stop!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)Spare me!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit - life threat threshold reached)I am defeated. Stop shooting!
(fleeing from combat)Enough of this. I will take my leave!
(pilot bailing from ship)Miserable wretch! Abandoning my vessel.
(relief line)I feel blessed that I survived.
(congratulations after combat from captain)Well done, everyone!
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in)We have new attack orders.
(new attack orders for multi-crew ship coming in during target)New attack orders!
(preparing new attack orders)Prepare to open fire on the target.
(preparing new attack orders during combat)Attack this target!
(reaction to friendly fire)Hey, will you stop firing?
(reaction to friendly fire)You're wrecking my shields!
(reaction to friendly fire)Why are you shooting me?
(enemy ship or station exploding)It's going to blow!
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)Your pathetic attempts will come to nothing.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)We will not be defeated so easily.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)Not good enough!
(variant)(enemy destroyed - taunt)In the name of the Paranid Empire!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)Your aggression will not go unpunished.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)That was foolish.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)More of the same can easily be arranged.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)The Paranid will be victorious.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)Your death will be swift.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)You will not live.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Your insults do not concern me.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)The Paranid are not so easily intimidated.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I am not impressed by you.
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)Under no circumstances.
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)You were in the way, but I did not intend to hit you.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - xenon)These unholy machines are becoming more accurate.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - silent enemy)The Paranid are not so easily defeated.
(variant)(missile use)Missiles will be the best option here.
(variant)(torpedo use)They will not survive a torpedo strike.
(variant)(losing an enemy)Time to lose this nuisance.
(variant)(losing an enemy)I will lose them now.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)You dare to attack with such inferior weapons?
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)I am unmoved by your efforts.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)This is just the start.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)Prepare yourself. You will not survive.
(variant)(NPC attempts bribe)You would do well to make a deal with me.
(variant)(NPC bribe succeeds)You have made a wise choice.
(variant)(NPC hired)You have made a wise decision by employing me.
Last order could not be completed.
(order added to queue - informal)It's been added to the list.
The order might take longer than expected.
Pass on new coordinates to following ships.
Inform me when all ships have arrived.
All ships have arrived at destination.
(command)Tell group leader we've spotted enemy activity.
(relay report)They say it's safe to engage.
(relay report)They say it's too risky to engage.
One of our wingmen is asking for backup.
(escort leaves)You're on your own from here.
(grateful)Might not have made it without you.
(during combat)Get on the line! We need backup, now!
(group of small ships - winning)We're all over them!
(group of small ships - winning)We've got them now!
(group of small ships - losing)They're all over us!
(group of small ships - losing)We can't stand this.
(response to distress call - singular)Hang on! I'm on my way!
(response to distress call - plural)We've received your call. We're on the way.
Please follow directions to designated docking position.
They've marked our docking position for us.
Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.
We're pleased to welcome you aboard.
(Informing player ship will soon undock)The ship will be undocking soon.
(Informing player ship will not undock before they return)I'll wait for you to tell me to take off.
(Informing player they will have to manually tell the pilot to take off)Let me know when you want to take off.
There's a ship preparing to undock.
Departing ship, you are clear to undock. Safe travels.
Bring away from the docking position. Slowly.
Use these criteria for the search.
I've found a trade offer matching our criteria.
Tell that station we are on our way.
(when a repair / upgrade order comes in)Which ship needs the work?
(variant)(fluff - moving from one part of the ship to another)Hm. This way.
(variant)(fluff - completed upgrade / repair)That is now significantly better.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. I)I am finishing my work.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. II)What do you want me to do next?
(order for new units)Let's make an order for new units.
(order for new ammo)Let's make an order for some more ammunition.
(cap ship repair)Ask the station to start repairs.
(cap ship / station repair)Launching repair units now.
(law enforcement respons to comms - followed up by comms greeting)This is sector security.
(ship scan warning - cargo)Please halt. We will be scanning your cargo hold.
(ship scan warning - inventory)Please halt. We will be scanning your inventory.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)Your scan results are clear, this time.
(ship scan result - something found)We've detected contraband.
(ordering to drop cargo/contraband)Release your contraband immediately.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - compliant)You may scan.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - nothing found)Of course!
(variant)(ship scanned by police - something found)You were not supposed to find that.
(variant)(ship scanned - illegal)That is against the law.
(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)Your cargo may be of interest to me.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)You have nothing!
(variant)(ship scan result)Your cargo is most definitely of interest to me.
(variant)(ordered to drop cargo - releases under duress)Take the cargo, lowerlife!
(variant)(ordered to surrender ship - surrenders under duress)My ship is yours.
(station / ship sabotaged - explosives)I'm noticing a small breach. It looks like someone used explosives on the hull.
(station / ship sabotaged - EMP)Electronics have gone dead somewhere. Someone used an EMP device.
(station / ship hacked)It looks like someone's hacked us.
(station security saw suspicious activity)We've picked up suspicious activity.
(station security saw suspicious activity - report inside managers office)Security vessels are reporting suspicious activity.
(manager response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Send out additional security vessels.
(manager / captain response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Launch emergency fighters.
Make sure service crew know to fix the damage.
(call to security forces - minor)Look out for any suspicious activity.
(call to security forces - major)Tell us of any suspicious activity immediately.
(call to security forces - search)Scan for suspicious activity.
Look only for our target resource.
(NPC moves onto player's ship)I'm aboard your ship and ready to go.
(NPC moves off player ship)The journey was not unpleasant. You have my thanks.
(No room on player's ship)You don't have enough room on your ship right now.
(NPC wants to leave ship)Drop me off at the nearest station.
(Player receives licence)Congratulations on your new licence.
(greeting - black marketeer - on introduction)(@voice confident but not drawing attention)If you're looking to find some black market merchandise, I'm the one to talk to.
(Friendly greeting)It's good to see you, friend.
(Allied greeting)It's an honour to see you here.
(Promotion ceremony - intro)You have done well to approach us in person.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, friendly)We have been observing you and your activities with some interest. Some have called for you to be recognised.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, allied)It pleases us that you have continued down this path. As such, you will be suitably rewarded.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', friendly)I am not displeased to present you with a new rank within the great Godrealm of the Paranid.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', allied)It is with great honour that I present to you, a new rank within the great Godrealm of the Paranid.
(Promotion ceremony)As with all honours bestowed by the Paranid, this comes with worthy benefits.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)Should you betray us, you will immediately lose these benefits, and shortly after, your life.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)As we have judged you worthy, we do not forsee this as a likely possibility.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)You will henceforth go and enjoy the rewards we have gifted you.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)There are a number of organisations within our empire that will see our decision as a reason to approach you.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)With our blessing, you are expected to continue your honourable behaviour.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)May the holy fires burn within you.
(Start of greeting)On behalf of our organisation: (keep space)
We need to damage the target further.
(to marine)Alright, get out of there. Abort.
(boarding pod launched)Pod launched. Moving to target.
(begin breach)We're making our way through the hull.
(marine lost during breach)Man down! Watch out for countermeasures on the hull!
One of the teams is pinned down.
(lots of fighting noise)We're taking heavy losses.
(lots of fighting noise)We're pushing through. Lots of resistance.
We've secured several sections. Moving on.
The commander is dead. We will resist to the last!
I have a team working on bypassing a lockdown.
The crew seems to be abandoning ship.
The self-destruct has been activated. We're working on disabling it.
I don't think we can make it to the bridge. Requesting abort.
I'm calling it. Abort! Get back to your pods!
(self-destruct imminent, somber)Sorry, Sir. This isn't looking good.
(target damaged)Don't destroy the target while we're in here!

We live in dark times. For centuries the Paranid lived in peace. Strife between us was a relic of the past. So dependent are we on the Pontifex that when the Jump Gates shut down and the Pontifex could not contact us, chaos ensued. Life fell into ruin. We searched desperately for guidance - some even going so far as to birth new leaders, each with their own perspective, each with their own ambitions. When the Jump Gates re-aligned, it could only end in conflict. Each Pontifex believed they were in the right; each unwilling to back down. Civil war was simply a matter of time.

I am proud to serve in this fight, on the side proven to be just. Now a single faction remains that refuses to return to the Godrealm. It is my duty to protect our people from their heresy, and to destroy any that would threaten our way of life.
(emergency event mission offer)I could really use some help right now.
(data leak signal - illegal opportunity)I'm taking a big risk by broadcasting, so if you decode this transmission, keep it to yourself. I have work that needs doing.
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone hear me?! Hello?! I'm not supposed to be broadcasting but I need help! Please! I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone here me?! I need help! Please, if you can hear this, I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help)Hey! I know this is unconventional, but if you can hear this, I could use some help.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Don't let them get away!
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal cargo on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal wares on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal data on drone detected.
(player looks at offer - generic)Are you interested in a job?
(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)Are you ready? We will be leaving soon and we will not wait for you.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)I am fully prepared. My share of the proceeds had better be worthwhile.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I need someone to take these... things. Will you buy them?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)Yes. You can find me in my usual location on this station.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)The items have been placed in a lockbox at these coordinates.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I am busy, but I will collect them when I am ready.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.

page.title: Paranid NPC 2 / Holy Order rep
page.descr: Lines for Paranid NPC 2
page.t: (Metadata, do not translate)[paranid] male female basic
(Goodbye - staff)Glad to have been of assistance.
(Greeting - rejected - big ship)We have nothing to say to you.
(* Honorifics - addressing crew in calm situations *)
The request came from a police vessel.
(suggestion for dealing with bad situation)Get us out of here!
(variant)(refusal to do something)I will not do that.
(chosen reward)Please take one of these as thanks.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - finds it funny)Your request cannot be serious.
(variant)(refusal to surrender - in danger)I will not surrender to you!
(informing player)I was asked to drop my cargo.
(informing player)I was forced to drop my cargo.
We need to perform a transfer.
(first warning - generic)We cannot tolerate your actions.
(first warning to an attacking ship)Stop your attack immediately.
(warning of consequences - generic)You will now suffer the consequences.
(warning of consequences - opening fire)You are now being targeted.
(warning of consequences - sending ships)Ships are now being dispatched.
(warning of consequences - reporting)You will now be reported to local security forces.
(report of attack - ships)Reporting an attack against this vessel.
(report of attack - stations)Reporting an attack against this station.
(law enforcement confirms report, after something like Affirmative)Criminal record has been updated.
(report of attack generic)Reporting a criminal offence.
(variant)(ship complies to police instructions)That was a good choice.
(ship does not comply)You have refused to comply.
(reporting)This is sector security reporting criminal activity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship)Take care. Security patrols may be in the vicinity.
(variant)(aboard a smuggling multi-crew ship that is caught)We have been exposed. What action should we take?
(variant)(response to above - rushed suggestion)Drop your cargo, quickly!
(variant)(ship complies to pirate instructions)Good. This one knows its place.
(report on enemy activity)Too risky to engage.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We were hit.
(capital or M-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)Something hit us.
(capital or m-sized ship / station hit without taking serious damage)We're taking hits.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They will be no match for our strength.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - serious threat threshold on attacked ship reached)They will not survive long.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Continue to attack the target.
(multi-crew ship attacking - captain response)Keep up the pressure on the target.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Do not respond to them.
(variant)(multi-crew ship attacking - life threat threshold on attacked ship reached - captain response)Show no mercy!
(variant)(retaliation)You will pay for your foolish actions.
(variant)(small ship hit, in danger, panic)Show mercy!

(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)Have mercy, please!
(variant)(generic - life threat threshold reached)I am not ready to die!
(variant)(multi-crew ship / station hit - life threat threshold reached)Spare our lives!

(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - response-capable)We are not so easy to defeat.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - generic)That was a poor attempt!
(variant)(enemy destroyed - report)The target has been destroyed.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)Your aggressive actions will be suitably punished.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - response-capable)That was unwise.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)We can provide plenty more of that.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)We will defeat you without difficulty.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)You will die quickly.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, panic - small ship)This will not end well for you.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I am unmoved by your insults.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)Do not threaten me!
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)I will not be intimidated.
(variant)(response to taunt - small ship)You are unimpressive.
(variant)(response to life threat threshold - small ship)Absolutely not.
(variant)(apology for friendly fire)If you keep out of the way, then I won't shoot you again.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - xenon)That machine actually hit me. It will have to be destroyed.
(variant)(single-crew ship hit without taking serious damage - silent enemy)I cannot be so easily defeated.
(variant)(missile use)I will defeat them with missiles.
(variant)(losing an enemy)This irritation has vexed me enough.
(variant)(losing an enemy)They will not be able to follow me.
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)You attack from a position of weakness!
(variant)(small ship hit, not in danger - generic)Your efforts do not move me.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - small ship)This is just the beginning.
(variant)(response to small ship hit, generic - big ship)You will not survive this.
(variant)(NPC attempts bribe)You would be well-advised to strike a deal with me.
(variant)(NPC bribe succeeds)Your judgment is suprisingly good.
(variant)(NPC bribe fails)That was not a good decision.
(variant)(NPC hired)You have made a wise choice in employing my services.
(variant)(NPC fired)I will find someone who values my work more highly.

(grateful)Might not have made it without you.
(during combat)Get on the line! We need backup, now!
(group of small ships - winning)We're all over them!

(group of small ships - losing)They're all over us!

They've marked our docking position for us.
Get the crew to ready a docking bay.
It's an honour to have you aboard.

(variant)(fluff - moving from one part of the ship to another)I am sure it is over here.

(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. I)I am close to finishing.
(variant)(fluff - finishing up pt. II)What would you like me to proceed with now?
(order for new units)Let's make an order for new units.
(order for new ammo)Let's make an order for some more ammunition.
(cap ship repair)Ask the station to start repairs.
(cap ship / station repair)Launching repair units now.
(law enforcement respons to comms - followed up by comms greeting)This is sector security.
(ship scan warning - cargo)Please halt. We will be scanning your cargo hold.
(ship scan warning - inventory)Please halt. We will be scanning your inventory.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)Your scan results show nothing untoward.
(ship scan result - something found)We've detected contraband.
(ordering to drop cargo/contraband)Release your contraband immediately.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - compliant)Scan request accepted.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - nothing found)Naturally! I am a righteous, law-abiding citizen.
(variant)(ship scanned by police - something found)Those things are my business and mine alone.
(variant)(ship scanned - illegal)You have broken the law!
(report to superior)My ship is being scanned.
(variant)(ship scan warning)I will examine your cargo.
(variant)(ship scan result - nothing found)I have found nothing!
(variant)(ship scan result)I have found things in your cargo that are of great interest to me.
(variant)(ordered to drop cargo - releases under duress)My cargo is now yours.
(variant)(ordered to surrender ship - surrenders under duress)You may have my ship, lowerlife!
(station / ship sabotaged - explosives)I'm noticing a small breach. It looks like someone used explosives on the hull.
(station / ship sabotaged - EMP)Electronics have gone dead somewhere. Someone used an EMP device.
(station / ship hacked)It looks like someone's hacked us.
(station security saw suspicious activity)We've picked up suspicious activity.
(station security saw suspicious activity - report inside managers office)Security vessels are reporting suspicious activity.
(manager response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Send out additional security vessels.
(manager / captain response to sabotage, hacking or suspicious activity)Launch emergency fighters.
Make sure service crew know to fix the damage.
(call to security forces - minor)Look out for any suspicious activity.
(call to security forces - major)Tell us of any suspicious activity immediately.

(NPC moves onto player's ship)I'm aboard your ship and ready to go.
(NPC moves off player ship)The journey was not unpleasant. You have my thanks.
(No room on player's ship)You don't have enough room on your ship right now.
(NPC wants to leave ship)Drop me off at the nearest station.
(Player receives licence)Congratulations on your new licence.
(greeting - black marketeer - on introduction)(@voice confident but not drawing attention)If you're looking to find some black market merchandise, I'm the one to talk to.
(Friendly greeting)It's good to see you, friend.
(Allied greeting)It's an honour to see you here.
(Promotion ceremony - intro)It pleases us that you have come in person.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, friendly)We have watched as you have performed a great number of exploits within our space. Our Order finds you worthy of some recognition.
(Promotion ceremony - cntd, allied)We remain moved that such fire burns within one such as yourself. It is something worthy of a grand gesture, of which we can bestow.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', friendly)In the name of the Holy Order of the Pontifex, I lift you to a new standing amongst us.
(Promotion ceremony - handing over 'medal', allied)With the holy light of the true Pontifex, it is an honour to bless you with a new title.
(Promotion ceremony)You will find that your position will include a number of benefits.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)In the event that you turn against us, we will wrench this title from you and serve judgement.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)However, with your noble character, we do not expect such a thing.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)Go and make these reward your own. We pray they help you continue on the path to enlightenment.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)You may also find that certain sanctioned groups with our Order will have gained interest in you. You will do well to not reject them.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)I again recognise your holy will.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)May the true Pontifex continue to guide you.
(Start of greeting)On behalf of our organisation: (keep space)
We need to damage the target further.
(to marine)Alright, get out of there. Abort.
(boarding pod launched)Pod launched. Moving to target.
(begin breach)We're making our way through the hull.
(marine lost during breach)Man down! Watch out for countermeasures on the hull!
One of the teams is pinned down.
(lots of fighting noise)We're taking heavy losses.
(lots of fighting noise)We're pushing through. Lots of resistance.
We've secured several sections. Moving on.
The commander is dead. We will resist to the last!
I have a team working on bypassing a lockdown.
The crew seems to be abandoning ship.
The self-destruct has been activated. We're working on disabling it.
I don't think we can make it to the bridge. Requesting abort.
I'm calling it. Abort! Get back to your pods!
(self-destruct imminent, somber)Sorry, Sir. This isn't looking good.
(target damaged)Don't destroy the target while we're in here!
(emergency event mission offer)I could really use some help right now.
(data leak signal - illegal opportunity)I'm taking a big risk by broadcasting, so if you decode this transmission, keep it to yourself. I have work that needs doing.
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone hear me?! Hello?! I'm not supposed to be broadcasting but I need help! Please! I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help - intense)Can anyone here me?! I need help! Please, if you can hear this, I need help!
(data leak signal - plea for help)Hey! I know this is unconventional, but if you can hear this, I could use some help.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Don't let them get away!
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal cargo on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal wares on drone detected.
(station masstraffic mini-mission)Illegal data on drone detected.
(player looks at offer - generic)Are you interested in a job?
(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)Do you wish to join our sortie? We are almost ready to leave.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)I am always prepared. I look forward to reaping the rewards.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)Do you wish to buy these? It is not safe for me to keep them.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)Yes. If you come to my usual location on this station then I will make the necessary arrangements.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)The items are at these coordinates, inside a lockbox.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)I will go and collect them when I have completed my current business.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.

(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 1)As you would expect, these benefits are tied to the rank. Should you lose it, the benefits will go too. A simple matter.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 2)But with your aptitude, you must recognise that as a foolish outcome.
(Promotion ceremony - fluff line to spread notifications out 3)Our humble group hopes that you find these rewards fitting. May it aid you in your endeavours.
(Promotion ceremony - subgroup licence hint)You may find that certain organisations under our jurisdiction will attempt to recruit you into their ranks. As with all things, concider carefully.
(Promotion ceremony - outro)I Once again thank you for your efforts.
(Promotion ceremony - outro cntd)We look forward to working with you more in the future.

(player looks at offer - easy difficulty)You shouldn't have any trouble with this.
(player looks at offer - hard difficulty)You'll need your wits about you for this.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - illegal opportunity)You decrypted my signal. Good.
(player looks at illegal mission offer)This could be lucrative for both of us.
(player looks at data leak mission offer - plea for help)I'm glad you found my signal.
(player looks at emergency mission offer or plea for help)I hope you can help!
(player looks at mission offer again - generic)So you're still interested?
(player looks at mission offer again - illegal opportunity)I knew you wouldn't resist.
(player looks at mission offer again - emergency or plea for help)You came back? Does that mean you'll help?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - call)We are preparing an operation, and you may join if you wish. What is your answer?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 01 - upcoming raid - response)I will come. You will need my superior skills if you are to succeed.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - call)I cannot safely store these items any longer. Will you buy them?
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 02 - black marketeer - response)I will buy them. Meet me at my usual location on this station.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - call)The items are in a lockbox. I will give you the coordinates.
(variant)(encounter offer - illegal activity 03 - lockbox - response)Yes, yes. I will get them when I am less busy.
(player declines mission offer)Come and find me if you change your mind.
(player declines mission offer - illegal opportunity)Ah... you'll be back. I'm sure.
(player declines mission offer - plea for help)What?! No! Please!
(player accepts mission offer)I knew I could count on you.
(reluctant for player to take mission - particularly hard missions, etc)Alright. If you think you can handle it.
(player accepts illegal opportunity)Smart move. Don't mess this up.
(player accepts plea for help or emergency mission offer)Thank you! Good luck!
(mission update)There's been a change of plans with the job.
(partial success)If that's the best you could do... sure.
(failed mission)I hope you don't think you're being paid for that.
(success in mission chain)We're one step closer to completion.
(failure in mission chain)That didn't go well, but we might still be able to salvage this.
(mission aborted by NPC / script failure)Sorry. Looks like your services are no longer required.
