While we expect the zealots of the 'Holy Order' are planning an offensive against us, we currently find reliable intel not so forthcoming. As this information is valuable in formulating tactics to crush them, we must rectify this immediately.

Given the recent skirmishes with the Order, it is clear that our knowledge on their fleet movements is somewhat lacking. This is clearly something we must address should we wish to regain our advantage and protect our borders.

There are many potential avenues leading to clarity on this matter but given our resources, we must be prudent in our approach. Admitting such shortcomings is difficult for any Paranid, but given our foe, it is understandable that they can challenge our intellect, if only for a short time.

The intel we do possess indicates that the Order is building their forces, but their target eludes us. We require pilots with a sharp mind to aid us in improving and expanding our intel gathering capabilities.

Our fleet has deployed to the most likely locations that a strike may occur, but the uncertainly has already caused us to lose ground in vital areas. We seek pilots willing to delve into enemy space to help us gather further intel.

While we have proven that our fleet is more than a match than anything the rebels of the Order can muster, we have found that the engagements we have chosen could have benefited from additional intelligence beforehand.

As we push back the Order it has become clear that the current level of our intelligence gathering is sorely lacking in comparison to our allies. We must improve this situation before we find ourselves somewhat dependent on the lesser races.

We, as Paranid, are expected to lead the way in scholastic and technological capability. We will amend the situation, but we must do so before we are prepared to deal the final blow against the heretics.
Our fleets grow restless and our allies ever bolder. We seek those who are skilled and righteous to join us in lighting the way.
The time has come to show our true strength to the heretics of the Order. Every loss we have faced only served to stoke our flame and now we find ourselves poised to deal a decisive blow.
Operations have commenced to drive these rebels from our space and push them to the brink. We do not expect such a fight against fellow Paranid to be settled quickly, but we will not relent.

We wish to bolster our fleets with support from trusted and proven pilots such as yourself. Assigned tasks will include protecting combat units, holding critical areas as well as pushing deep into enemy territory.

We find ourselves in the advantageous position of pushing into 'Holy Order' space at a time where they are weakened by previous engagements. We shall take this opportunity to drive them to the brink before showing them the error of their ways.
It is clear from their lack of aggression that they neither have the zeal nor capability to call themselves the true Paranid Empire.

Our fleets are poised to push into the sector and we are looking for auxiliary ships to perform secondary objectives. Such tasks will involve supporting our ships, securing strategic areas and intercepting enemy forces. Only skilled pilots should apply.

We have received requests from neighbouring systems that they fear that the Order will soon encroach on their space. As their failure to defend their borders will adversely affect our current strategy, we have agreed to aid them in fortifying their space. One such method is through the deployment of mines.

As we share a border with the 'Holy Order', we shall prepare a number of static defences to deter them from any rash action. Along with redeploying our fleet to other strategic areas, this will serve to secure our space from any future aggression by the Order. We request a pilot to aid us by deploying a number of mines.

The so-called 'Holy Order' wishes to attack the areas in which our mining ships operate. Instead of diverting our forces from vital areas elsewhere, we shall have a number of laser towers placed to help safeguard these regions.

At the request of our intelligence division, we require a single satellite to be placed in a vital area. We not only want to gain sensor data for that region, we also want to bait the Holy Order into some response. Anything we can do to dictate their movements or reveal their strength will aid us when we have to make a move ourselves.

While our primary focus in this area is the conflict with the Order, we must also be vigilant in the case that another threat seeks to take advantage of the situation. To do that, we require a network of satellites to be deployed throughout our space.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

A number of our vessels were damaged in the last engagement with the Order. While our shipyards continue to expand our forces we are looking for skilled individuals to help in the repair a number of our ships. Much of the work will be external, as our capable crews tirelessly continue to repair the internal systems.

An important dignitary is making a tour across our space, visiting a number of stations to speak to them regarding our conflict with the Order. (Paranid male)He has requested to be transported in a low-key manor as to not occupy any of our forces, nor to make a grandiose arrival. Such things will only distract from the message he is trying to preach.

We require a new military installation to be built in a specified location to better deter the Order from reckless acts in our space. The following specifications state our demands for such a structure.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

We wish to know, in great detail, what resources are available to the heretics so that we can better judge how weak their infrastructure actually is. To do so, we must closely measure the yields in their space. We expect to find the following: $WARENAMES$
(next ID reserved for gender)Silence a Heretic Sympathiser

(ma target)The heretics continue to use underhanded methods to bring more scum into their ranks. We have learned that $NPCName$, a once-trusted contractor for a number of our shipyards has been receiving a number of databursts from enemy space. Thanks to our intelligence network, we have decrypted such messages and the outcome is unfortunate for him.

(fe target)The heretics continue to use underhanded methods to bring more scum into their ranks. We have learned that $NPCName$, a once-trusted contractor for a number of our shipyards has been receiving a number of databurts from enemy space. Thanks to our intelligence network, we have decrypted such messages and the outcome is unfortunate for her.
(ma target)\nThey are most likely aboard the ship with ID: $SHIPID$. May they have a swift end.
(fe target)\nThey are most likely aboard the ship with ID: $SHIPID$. May they have a swift end.

(ma target)It is unfortunate, but $NPCName$ has turned against the light and has joined the damnable heretics. We have given him a chance to return to his post but his subsequent refusal leaves him denounced and a target for elimination. His last act for the Paranid Empire will be to serve as an example.
(ma target)\nHe is flying the ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Do not let him go any further.

We have selected a ship under control of heretics to be a target for a data-extraction operation. We demand the ship be engaged, boarded and its data-core cloned for us to analyse. What happens to the ship beyond that is of little concern to us.
As we push into hostile space, we request a number of units to help support our fleet. Any volunteers must expect combat.

To greater improve our chances of striking back against the Order of the False Pontifex heretics, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to take command of our ships. These pilots should be brought to one of our stations before the fighting starts.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

To ensure that our military installations are performing at peak efficiency during the war against the heretics of the Order of the False Pontifex, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to one of our stations.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

While our fleet continues to push the heretics to the brink, we must continue to bolster our forces. We request a number of independent suppliers to support our shipyards in delivering ships to aid in the conflict. Deliver the ships with the following specifications to $SECTOR$:\n$FLEET$

We have high expectations of our infrastructure, even during the strains of a prolonged conflict. Preparations must be made to ensure key stations continue to function even in cases of extreme shortages. Aid the specified station in reaching the stated minimum storage threshold.\n\nMinimum storage level: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

(singular)It seems the Order are having issues fitting ships with certain equipment due to supply shortages. We believe they have begun to strip such components from older ships, which gives us an opportunity to directly disrupt their fleet mobilisation. Destroy a ship matching the following specification.$SPECS$

(plural)It seems the Order are having issues fitting ships with certain equipment due to supply shortages. We believe they have begun to strip such components from older ships, which gives us an opportunity to directly disrupt their fleet mobilisation. Destroy ships matching the following specification.$SPECS$

The light's dogma clearly states that one's temper and aspirations must be controlled diligently. After all, unshackled imagination leads to radical vision, and ultimately heresy. The events which caused our former brethren to shut their ears to the guidance of our most benevolent Pontifex, and tragically forsake their assured salvation, are well beyond the scope of us humble servants. Nevertheless, there remains no question that the use of tempting substances must be decisively quashed! To aid in this most righteous of tasks, you are hereby commissioned to search passing ships for Spaceweed.

Despite their inferior morals and misguided faith, the heretics continue to be a worthy match for our mighty battle fleets. This comes as no surprise, since they are able to feed on the bountiful technological advancements wrought over millennia of research by our greatest, enlightened minds. It has therefore been decided that we must temporarily return to the old ways and overwhelm the slaves of the False Pontifex by sheer numbers. To approximate the potential of their military output, we require you to search for enemy transports carrying Hull Parts.

It is becoming increasingly obvious that this holy war cannot be won through attrition, as long as the heretics continue to make use of our own technology. By priestly decree, we have therefore begun to target their production of Superfluid Coolant, which is vital in keeping superior Paranid weaponry and engines from overheating. It has now come to our attention, that one of our warrior scouts close to the border has misused this information to make deals with our enemy for his own profit. To identify the accomplices of this apostate, we need you to find and scan Heretic Order ships carrying Superfluid Coolant.

We deciphered this minefield's encrypted transmission and can replicate its status messages. This means we can destroy it without making the Heretic Order aware of their missing minefield. Should they ever rely on it as an escape route, they will be very shocked to find it missing.
We predict that in response to our recent actions, the Priest Duke will have issued an order for a minefield. Removing it from the equation enables our next move.

We were able to sabotage a group of laser towers, but in the process also left clues. An investigation would allow them to analyse our approach and apply countermeasures. Now, instead of making use of our sabotage, we have to destroy the laser towers to cover our tracks before they put two and two together.

In their desperation, the Heretic Order put up a couple of cheap laser towers with weak security software. This risks exposing our superior Paranid algorithms to the rest of the Gate network, which cannot be allowed.

page.title: Holy Order vs Argon War
page.descr: Texts for the 'Holy Order vs Argon war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: In its infinite stupidity, the Argon Federation has sided with the weak and pathetic Godrealm of the Paranid and have joined in their fight against us. The fools have made a grave error in judgement. We seek a brave and strong warrior to join our fight and show those that stand against us that they will know no victory.

Every day we let the weak and pitiful Argon Federation work against us, the more our supremacy and our righteousness are doubted. This doubt is erroneous and we cannot abide it. If you believe your will is indomitable and you are fearless in the face of battle, we challenge you to prove yourself now!
The Argon Federation again masses on our borders. We must be ready to drive them back.
The watchers that remain in Argon space tell us that the Federation dares prepare its forces.
The ever-predictable Argon Federation once again underestimates our resolve and our readiness.
Our many watchers, on the ground and across the void, confirm a build up of Federal military assets.

The Argon Federation has pulled its tail from between its legs and prepares to skirmish into our space. A... concerning number of ships has been spotted on our borders, and we fear that we are currently too easy a target.
The Argon Federation is coming for us. While our watchers continue to gather data on Argon Federation behaviour and analyse it, we must make sure our defences are strong.
There is much we can, much we must do to make sure our space is well defended.

The enemy is correct to believe that they have the upper hand, but we have time to prepare our defences and disprove their belief. The Pontifex demands that we survive this fight, so that we may show our worth on our terms when we are able.

There is still time in which to properly prepare our defences and ready our people from any Federation strike that may come. We demand that someone help us to this end, so that we might fight another day.

Desperate to prove their wretched selves, the Argon Federation continues to throw its forces at our defensive line without thought for their lives. Our defences and our people have, are and will always be strong.

Our well-hidden watchers continue to do good work, reporting that the Federation dare to build up forces against us nearby. We expect that they will soon make a move against us. We shall use this time they have foolishly granted us to ready our defences.
Should they dare to strike, we shall meet them in glorious battle, and protect our space with easy. We must simply be ready for whatever they think to throw at us.
We ask on all of those loyal to the Holy Order, anyone who knows that we are the way forward, to ensure that we are prepared. Will you join us in the defence of our people?

Conflict approaches as the Argon Federation once again prepares to test our strength. Reports speak of masses of all kinds of combat ships, stocked for days of struggle, holding steady on the other side of our borders.

We must once again prepare ourselves for the long fight; the Argon Federation makes ready for yet another assault. Newly built or quickly prepared combat ships, all armed and armoured. Preparing to strike.

Our forces remain stretched from previous assaults. We must match the Federation blow for blow with new ships and defensive structures.Our shipwrights are already hard at work preparing the materials for suitably effective warships, and our military scientists prepare to build more static defences.

We require much aid in these areas. We must prepare our space for anything the Argon Federation can throw at us. Any worthy individual who is able and prepared to invest significantly into the preparation effort will help in this regard.

We know time is short - the Federation could strike at any time - but any assistance in these areas will play a momentous part in the defence of our great people, and of course also future engagements with the Argon Federation.

The foolish Argon Federation have not learned their lesson, and move against us again. They expect us to bow to the power of their shining new fleets, but we know they are coming, and we will answer their call in kind.

The watchers we have placed in Argon Federation space have informed us of ships massing within easy range of our space. It is a strong offence, but we know that it is coming, and we have no qualms in preparing appropriately.
While our warships and static defences have proven themselves time and time again, we will continue to strengthen them in the face of aggression from the Argon Federation.
Our warships and our static defences have proven themselves time and time again, and will continue to do so as we strengthen them in the face of this needless Argon aggression.
We seek those loyal to our cause that can aid us with significant time and resources, so that we may prepare our defences against anything the Federation throws at us.

Reports begin to state that the Argon Federation builds up its forces. Rumours of war times are mounting. We must take action, and we know that with no honour, the Federation will not only strike at our defences, but at our supply lines as well.

We stand once again on the brink of war with the Argon Federation. Action must be taken to ensure we repel yet another gruelling conflict. When the enemy strikes, we must make ready for anything and everything they may throw at us.
Our resources, our supply lines, must remain safe. They are too important to lose. We must find and protect raw materials and stockpile the wares we currently lack.

The Argon Federation, the cowards that they are, may make it difficult for our people to trade in peace, but with your aid, and the aid of the Pontifex's great fleet, our foundations may remain strong, and we may focus on dealing with these pests' aggression once and for all.

Though our people are strong, these wars we wage have put strain on our infrastructure and supply lines - our construction projects are slow, and our people must ration their supplies. This cannot be allowed to continue. We require the skills of our able pilots to help us reverse the situation.

The Argon Federation will soon make another attempt to break us with a strike at our territory - so say the watchers. Having failed so many times before to destroy our defences, we begin to wonder whether they learn from their mistakes and will choose to target other areas instead.

Once more the Federation hopes to dash itself against the imperial might of our defences in order to break our spirit. The watchers say that they prepare another attack, and we will be prepared for them to attack not just our defences but, like the cowards they are, our civilian population as well.

As we press forwards with our own offensive, we must ensure that our supplies and our people remain safe, and that our economy runs smoothly. Our supply lines, our mining sources require protection - any new sources of raw resources we can find must be defended.

The enemy attempts to destroy us by targeting our people, humble and innocent civilians, but with the assistance of pilots such as you, and the might of the Pontifex's holy fleet, our economy will remain strong, and we will focus on destroying the Argon Federation instead.

The brave watchers we have placed in Argon Federation territory have informed us that the Federation prepares yet another assault against us. We grow tired of these games, and have decided to respond in kind, in an attempt to change our fortune in this war.

Any being with eyes can see for themselves what is to come; the Argon Federation puts us on the back foot with another massing of warships on our borders. We begin to fear another assault. Our best chance of survival is to respond in kind; a surprise assault to take the advantage.
We will strike quickly, seeking out targets that cause no concerns for our fleets. We suspect this will draw the Federation's attention away from the fronts where our forces are stretched thin.
Neutralising these targets will destabilise the enemy and throw them into disarray. We hope this will give us an important, even decisive edge once we have prepared our next major offensive.

The Argon Federation, proving more cunning than usual, have forced our hand. That said, we do believe that striking these targets will turn the tide in our favour. In some measure, it will show the Federation that we are still willing to fight.

Once more the watchers we have placed in Argon Federation space have proven their worth! We know now that the Federation prepares to move against us, and our brilliant tacticians already prepare a counter offensive. We are looking for any brave and gifted pilots to take part!

It was almost inevitable that the Argon Federation move against us again, so many times they have tried and failed to crush us. Our strategists are forever looking for new ways to defeat the Argon agressors, and we have full confidence in this new approach.
We continue to strengthen our own defensive position, but we must be prepared for the next phase of the conflict with the Argon Federation.
We cannot simply commit a large number of our forces to the attack. Not without first removing strategic targets whose absence will destabilise the enemy defences.

Our watchers alone are not currently able to establish whether the ever-restless Argon Federation move against us. We require swifter and more active intelligence to be able to plan against the pests. In this task, we require some assistance.

In recent weeks we have had nothing but whispers from our watchers in Argon Federation space. We must be able to watch them closely, even more closely than we do, if we are to properly prepare for their offenses, but some help is required in this.

Our intelligence network is being outmatched, and we must improve upon it. There is a plan to make these improvements in place, but a skilled and and brave pilot is required. They must be able to work alone, likely behind enemy lines.

The Argon are likely confident. Past behaviour dictates this makes them overconfident; stretching beyond their means to meet their targets. With an improved intelligence network, we can quickly identify poorly defended targets and plan strikes against them.

Our strategists are confident in their plan to complete their intelligence network in Argon space and give us an important edge on the Argon Federation. Knowing what they are up to, as well as where it is best for us to strike, may prove decisive in this conflict.

The war against the Argon Federation rages on, with no clear end in sight. We will continue to do what we must for our people, but there is no way of knowing how long this will take. Meanwhile, our strategists must continue to expand our intelligence network, and we seek your aid in this.

The Argon Federation might be weak, but they have been consistent in their strikes, and they may have been lucky to break us were it not for our mighty preparations. We must continue to operate as such, if we wish to win this war. At the centre of these preparations is one of our greatest assets.

Each and every one of those that work to improve and maintain our intelligence network is a hero, and will be honoured as such when the fighting is through. Until then, they must continue to prove their worth.

We seek others that can operate against the Argon Federation in Argon Federation space. They must be trusted, in all senses of the word. These tasks are certainly not without risk, but the reward gained from them will ensure we have an advantage against the Argon.
Our conflict with the Argon Federation has turned against us and we have suffered setback after setback. The enemy has made advances on several fronts. The Pontifex begins to question our resolve.
We must prove that we will fight until we are victorious, and prove to the Argon that we will not stand idle while they take our space. There will be struggle, but it will be worth it.

Our fleets must have support; critical areas of our space must be held while we rebuild our defences. We require the bravest and most skilled pilots to help us in our offensive; those who would give their lives for the cause of the Holy Order.
The time has come. We are prepared to deal a heavy, if not fatal blow to the pathetic Argon Federation. We will give them no quarter, and they will know the glory and the power of the Pontifex.
They already cower, their tails between their legs and they know their doom approaches. We will advance into their space and we will halt all counter-aggression that they hope to achieve.

Support our fleets in their offensive, and defend our space from any who would seek to enter it. Be part of this glorious assault. If you are skilled, if you are driven, then you can help us destroy our enemies.

There are many situations in war where a strong supply may prove the difference between life or death. Blockades, famines, contaminations. We must keep ourselves well supplied if we are to survive this. Help stock stations with food for their workforces and civilian populations.

Our shipyards and equipment docks must remain stocked with supplies if we are to remain prepared for this conflict. Only then can we quickly and efficiently build our fleets. Please help us in this endeavour by delivering these supplies to us.

We have hired others to help us build our larger military installations where they are needed, but many areas lack smaller defences that are effective in different scenarios. We require laser towers to be placed in areas we have highlighted as vulnerable to enemy attack.

With the reports from our watchers now available to us, we calculate only a few positions from which the Argon Federation may strike. If we preemptively place mines in these areas, we may be able to hinder or completely halt incoming attacks. We require someone to place a number of mines in one of these areas.

If we cannot stop the Argon Federation from striking at our space, then at least we may slow down their attack. We require defensive mines to be placed within our territory, where the enemy may be caught off guard while our own fleets avoid the chaos.

It is vital that we do not lose key resources areas to the Argon Federation while the conflict continues. We require you to place laser towers at strategy points in our most valuable regions, so that our economy may be protected.

The order has come through from our strategists to place a single satellite in an area of great importance to the war effort. Naturally, we will gather as much sensor data as possible, but more importantly it might goad the Argon Federation into a response. If we can dictate their movements, or reveal some of their strength, our strateges will be able to gauge an appropriate response.

Our satellite network is not only necessary to keep an eye on the ever-suspicious movements of the Argon Federation, but also to be able to sight and follow potential threats in our own space. You are required to reinforce this network.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

We require you to deploy some satellites in nearby Argon Federation territory in order to get a better picture of their preparations and gauge our own response. These satellites may not last long, but the information they reap before destruction remains valuable.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Many ships have been damaged throughout the conflict with the Argon Federation. Our shipyards are working at full capacity, but many ships are kept waiting. This strain is unacceptable. While the crew continues to repair internal systems, we require you to assist with hull and external sub-system repairs.

A number of Paranid specialists on Argon military history and tactics are to be transported to locations along the front line, to assess and help in our preparations. They must be provided swift and safe transport by a number of different pilots.

We require a new military installation to be built in a location we deem strategic, in order to help us deter Argon Federation agression. The facility must be made to fit the following specifications.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Even while fighting two separate conflicts, we must ensure that our economy remains healthy, which means securing the raw resources our stations require. We need you to seek out a region with high yields of the following resources: $WARENAMES$

Much can be learned about the Argon Federation's future operations against us if we know what resources they have available to them inside their own space. We require a resource scout to find this out for us by searching for regions with high yields of the following resources: $WARENAMES$
(next ID reserved for gender)Argon Federation Agent Uncovered

(ma target)After weeks of hunting, we have finally identified an Argon Federation spy who has been passing information to them from our space. $NPCName$ has spent weeks using his position as a station engineer to uncover sensitive data concerning our economy. He failed to break into the last system he attempted, and is now on the run.

(fe target)After weeks of hunting, we have finally identified an Argon Federation spy who has been passing information to them from our space. $NPCName$ has spent weeks using her position as a station engineer to uncover sensitive data concerning our economy. She failed to break into the last system she attempted, and is now on the run.
(ma target)\nHe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Remove him.
(fe target)\nShe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Remove her.

(ma target)During one of our last engagements with the Argon Federation, one of our trusted pilots turned coat for the enemy. $NPCName$ has since found protection from the Federation, in return for sensitive data concerning our tactics and strategies. Our watchers have now been able to find him, and we wish to stop him from revealing all of our secrets.

(fe target)During one of our last engagements with the Argon Federation, one of our trusted pilots turned coat for the enemy. $NPCName$ has since found protection from the Federation, in return for sensitive data concerning our tactics and strategies. Our watchers have now been able to find her, and we wish to stop her from revealing all of our secrets.
(ma target)\nHe is flying the ship: $SHIPID$. We would like him dealt with.
(fe target)\nShe is flying the ship: $SHIPID$. We would like her dealt with.

We believe we have found an Argon Federation ship that is key to their recent battles, and may contain important data we can use to turn the tide. The ship must be engaged and boarded so that any data from the ship's board computer may be analysed. It may prove to be decisive in the battles to come.
We plan to push Argon Federation forces from our space. During this operation our warships will require support, and we would like you to deliver that in which ever way you can.

Our fleet is almost complete and require a number of pilots to take command of them, so that we may strike back against the Argon Federation. $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) with the following skills should be brought to $DESTINATION$ before the fighting begins.\n$SKILLS$

Our military installations are in place and it is almost time for the fighting to begin again. These installations must perform at highest efficienty and we seek $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to $DESTINATION$ for distribution. They must have the following skill set:\n$SKILLS$

This war will ultimately be won on the front line, and as such we require a fleet. Our shipyards and wharfs work at highest efficiently, but still we require the support of independent suppliers. To aid in our efforts against the Argon Federation, please bring the following ships to $SECTOR$:\n$FLEET$

One of our stations has suffered greatly in the course of this conflict, but you can salvage the situation by fulfilling open trade orders. The station must reach the specified minimum storage levels.\n\nMinimum storage level: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

(singular)We have come to believe that the Argon Federation are testing new ship configurations on certain versions of their warships. This allows us a grand opportunity to disrupt the Federation research and development program. Seek out a ship with the following specification and destroy it:\n$SPECS$

(plural)We have come to believe that the Argon Federation are testing new ship configurations on certain versions of their warships. This allows us a grand opportunity to disrupt the Federation research and development program. Seek out a number of ships with the following specification and destroy them:\n$SPECS$

We suspect one of our agents has double-crossed us and is secretly working for the Argon Federation. We cannot act without proof and if we send our forces after them, we may scare them off. We are looking for someone to deep-scan their ship for us. The information from this scan will help inform whether we have been betrayed. $PERCENT$

After the construction of a new station in their space, the Argon Federation are seeing a boom in their economy. It is highly unusual for a single station to have such an effect, and we wish to know what they have done to achieve it. Perhaps with this information, we may use the advantage for ourselves. You are requested to provide us with a deep scan of the station. $PERCENT$

We require a skilled and trusted pilot for a potentially dangerous mission. We require information to be taken from a module on a high-security Argon Federation station; a station we believe that in this moment is critical to the Federation war effort. Perform a deep scan of the module and send us the data you retrieve. We will analyse whether our efforts should be focused there. $MODULE$

The Argon Federation has sent an agent into our space to tempt our people into illicit products that they do not need. It is a deliberate attempt to destabilise us, and we will not stand for it. The exact identity of the Federation agent is unknown. Please scan ships in our space and report any that carry the following: $WARE$

It seems the Argon Federation has sent a number of agents into our space to sell items we deem illegal to our people. This is a vicious and devious attempt to destabilise us and our war effort. These criminals must be found! Scan ships and report any pilots that are caught carrying the following: $ITEM$

The Argon Federation has set a dangerous individual loose on us. They have been targeting key personnel in our armed forces and continue to evade our security. We are able to provide you information on their last known location - they must be found before they can move too far. Find them and report their ship. We will take it from there: $PERSONNAME$

Our watchers have informed us that the Argon Federation has allowed a vicious criminal to escape into Holy Order territory. We have not yet been able to locate the ship, though we know from where it has come. We require a trusted agent to seek out the ship and inform us of its location so that our watchers may track its movements: $IDCODE$

The True Pontifex has decided to put the Argon infidels back in their place. As is to be expected from such inferior beings, incapable even of speaking our language, their cognitive capabilities aren't their own. Instead, they are dependent on technology to make decisions for them, thus creating the illusion of civilisation. By attacking their production chain of information processing components, we will thrust them back onto the planets on which they belong. To identify the logistics of their chip production facilities, you are ordered to find and scan Argon ships transporting: $WARE$.

An attack on these insignificant laser towers indicates our lack of knowledge of easier, yet more important, targets. This act, among others, will obscure their evaluation of our abilities and push them towards engaging in an unfavourable fight.

Our opponent's military research includes strategic software. According to our informant, countering it will be quite expensive. To avoid this, and make the Argon Federation cut funding, we need to undermine its performance tests. Right now it is tasked with placing laser towers. Destroying everything it tries to set up should make them realise this software's inability to compete with our strategists.

page.title: Holy Order vs Paranid War
page.descr: Texts for the 'Holy Order vs Paranid war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: The so-called Godrealm of the Paranid name us heretics, but it is they who betray our beliefs and our principles. They are weak, and they must be crushed. It is simply a matter of time before we know victory against them, but we still seek brave and strong warriors to join our fight and share in our righteous glory! Praise be to the true Pontifex!

Every day that the old order is allowed to reign over the Paranid and influence the space around us is a day lost to the glory of our great people! We fight to restore this glory. If you wish to share in our surpremecy, if you are fearless and strong in battle, you are challenged to prove your worth!
The Godrealm of the Paranid again masses on our borders. We must be ready to drive them back.
The watchers that remain in Godrealm space tell us that they dare prepare their forces against us.
In their foolishness, the old and feeble order once again underestimates our resolve and ambition.
Little does the Godrealm know that our watchers see their every step, and that we know they move against us.

The false Godrealm has made use its superior resources and makes ready another skirmish into out space. They have amassed a great number of ships close to our borders and concern grows that we are not strong enough to defend ourselves.
Those in Godrealm space that support us have spoken. The Godrealm prepares to move against us again. We must learn what it is we face, and in the meantime prepare our defences as best we can.
There is no end in sight in this discouraging war of Paranid against Paranid. Anything we do now to improve our defences may help us for some time yet.

The false Godrealm know that the advantage is currently theirs. They may strike soon, but we will make our defences strong before they do. We require able bodies and strong minds to help us make ourselves ready.

There is a small window in which we may shore up our defences and ready ourselves for the battles that are to come. Any advantage the false Godrealm has must be minimised. We are looking for help in this.

The false Godrealm prepares to throw itself at our indomitable strength once again, believing false that it can crush us. They prepare a skirmish into our territory. This endeavour of theirs is doomed to failure.
Those Paranid in Godrealm space who have seen the light of our Holy Order report that the Godrealm foolishly prepare warships and installations nearby. This means only one thing. Invasion.
When they arrive, for arrive they will, we will meet them as we have before and give them no quarter. We will be prepared for whatever they might throw at us.
We call on anyone who believes in our victory; all local forces, corporations and any willing and able civilians to make sure we are prepared. Will you join us in our heroic defence?
Open combat with our disenchanted Godrealm cousins is all but an inevitability. Reports talk of masses of newly-built combat ships, stocked and ready for days of conflict, converging on our borders.

We seek aid from any who belief in the glory of our Holy Order as the false Godrealm prepares to test our already crippled defences. Masses of combat ships, armed to the teeth, wait at our borders, waiting to strike.

Our forces are stretched thin. Our chance of survival lies in the construction of new ships and new defensive structures. Our shipyards work at full capacity, at all hours. Architects and engineers have been commandeered and work as fast as they are able. Our large-scale defences may still be ready before the strike.

To have any chance of success, we still need much support. Any individiual who is able and willing to invest significant resources and time into our defensive preparations will go a long way to stopping the false Godrealm.

Time is short. The false Godrealm could strike at any moment and our defences must be sured. Any aid we receive in the construction of fleets and static defences will play a key part in this unexpected fight for survival.

The disillusioned forces of the false Godrealm prepare once more to engage us. The expect that due to their strong fleets, we will ignore their lies and side with them. They are wrong. We know they are coming, and we shall prepare for their arrival with unbroken spirit.

Both our watchers and our military scouts report of Godrealm fleets beginning to mass at the Jump Gates that lead to our territory. It is a strong offensive that they prepare, with many new ships. Now that we know of their arrival though, we can prepare appropriately.

In the face of this newly-found agression from the false Godrealm, we shall rely on the warships and defensive structures that have proven themselves time and again, and we shall rely on indefatigable purpose.
We seek any individual who knows this purpose, to assist us with their precious time and resources so that our defences may be even more bolstered against the forces of the false Godrealm.

The apostate Godrealm builds up their forces once more and talk of conflict spreads quickly across all of Paranid space. The time has come for us to take action. If they seek to end us, which we know they do, it will never be enough to target our defences alone.

Conflict threatens to tear apart our space once more in this never-ending conflict against the false and hypocritical Godrealm. We must take action, lest this time we be unwound by their offence. Before the conflict arrives, we must be ready for every scenario.

As with all life, we depend on resources to survive, and those resources must be safeguarded in the case of assault. Raw materials must be found and protected. Whatever resource we do not have we must stock up on.

We commandeer civilian freighters to help us with this, but in order to accelerate the safeguard, we must also depend on pilots such as yourself to ensure that our infrastructure continues to run smoothly, despite Godrealm efforts. This work must continue, so that our forces may focus on dealing with enemy aggression directly.

Both wars we wage have put a great strain on our stations and supply lines. Our construction projects are slow, our people are rationing carefully. This cannot be the end of us. We require the skills of able pilots to help bolster our economy and help us turn the tide.

It comes time again for the false Godrealm to attempt another strike at our territories. Though they are weak, and apostate, they are still Paranid, and the fools may yet learn from their past mistakes. It is not enough to target our defences in order to destroy us, and should they have finally learned this, we must be prepared.

Though we hold the advantage in this conflict, the Godrealm attempt once more to strike and break our spirit. Intelligence reports indicate that they prepare another attack, not just against our fleets and defences, but out of sheer desperation, our civilian-run infrastructure as well.

We will press forward against the falsely led Paranid the Godrealm throws against us, but we must still ensure our economy functions smoothly. Our supply lines and our mining fields must remain protected, and new sources of resources must be found or established.

We look not only to our civilian traders to make sure of this, but also to allies and independents who wish to aid us. We have faith that when the fighting starts, our reserves will be well stocked, and our economy as strong as ever. With this in our hearts and mind, we may bring an end to the false Godrealm.

Though at this point it may come to nought, we believe there is some truth to the rumours that the Godrealm prepare another attack against us. They are ever unrelenting. To win this war, we must prove just as implacable; just as ruthless. We will strike before we can be struck.

Outside of our realm, people speak of our inevitable defeat. The Godrealm prepares once again to strike out at us in the hope that we might be crushed. Should another assault be on the horizon, then we wish to strike first - a warning, if you will, that rumours of our demise are strictly untrue.

The Godrealm do hold somewhat of an advantage against us, and we must strike low-risk targets in the hope that we may draw their attention away from the fronts where we might find ourselves outnumbered.
Our strategists have dictated that neutralising these targets will destabilise the enemys's cohesion, as well as tip the balance back towards our favour when the time comes for their next assault.

Our hand has been forced by the Godrealm, but our strategists do believe that striking these targets will tip the scales of war back towards our goals. At the very least, it may be a message to the Godrealm, that we will go down fighting.

We reach a respite in this time of war. The false Godrealm finally relent. Though we are sure they scheme and plot against us, there is no active preparation, and we find ourselves with an advantage to unearth. We will strike while they rest, and you are welcome to partake.

Though the watchers have been quiet as of late, it is only a matter of time before the Godrealm comes for us again. We, already prepared as we are, relish the possibility of striking first, in order to embarass the old order while it respites.
We will continue to strengthen our position while we await the order, but there are active preparations still to be made before we strike the apostate.
Instead of committing a large number of our forces immediately, we will send smaller strike teams into Godrealm space to attack strategic targets that will destabilise the enemy defence.

Many a brave watcher has been captured or killed while operating in Godrealm space, and now we suspect they move against us again but lack the intelligence to plan against it effectively. We require new watchers to help us resolve this.

The false Godrealm has actively sought to destroy our intelligence network and cripple our ability to pre-emptively plan against them. We require this intelligence network to be rebuilt so that we may know when the enemy will strike.

Our still brilliant strategists have been working hard on a plan to find any kind of solution, but it will require skilled individuals who can work alone and behind enemy lines to carry it out, lest our intelligence falter and we be caught off-guard.

From the very little we can gather, the Godrealm has grown confident and has begun to stretch their forces beyond a reasonable measure. If we can rebuild our intelligence network, perhaps we can find where they are weakest, and know exactly where to strike.

Our intelligence network must be rebuilt quickly. We must know when defences are necessary and when it is wisest for us to strike. Our strategists are confident that should we manage this rebuilding, we can claw back an advantage in this ever-ongoing conflict.

Behind the warships and defensive structures that keep our people safe, there are also the many brave watchers that observe the enemy from inside their own territory to report their plans and their movements. As long as there is a war to fight, these people too require our aid.

The key to victory in this war against the Godrealm of the Paranid is the preparations that we are continually able to make. Such preparations would not be possible were we not to know in advance what we face, and we can only do this with the help of our intelligence network. Of course, this too needs our support.

In order to move forward in this otherwise endless conflict, we must continue to build and maintain the intelligence network that has already proven its worth a hundred times, and a hundred times again.

We seek more people, trusted and brave, who may put their skills to the test as a member of this intelligence network. Working alone, behind enemy lines, is not for the feint of heart, but it will certainly help us maintain our current advantage.

Territory has been lost and gained, swapped between the Holy Order and the Godrealm sometimes on a weekly basis as long as the war has been waged. Currently, we find ourselves with less than we are comfortable with, and are making plans to reverse this situation.

It will be a prolonged fight, even a struggle, to drive the apostate back out of our space, away from our people, but we are committed to this plan of action, and we have faith in the Pontifex's guidance.

Our warships must be supported when we push the enemy back, and when we sound the defensive to regroup and recapture our strength, the line must be held. We require brave and skilled warriors to help us in our objectives, for the glory of the one true Pontifex!

After so much hard work from all of our forces, we are now in a position to deal a heavy blow to the Godrealm of the Paranid. It is time to free our people from the clutches of the old order, to claim the space that is rightfully ours!

The fight will be hard, perhaps the hardest yet, but the apostate Godrealm is on the back foot, and we will press this advantage, giving them no quarter! Any attempt they make to launch an attack against us will be hindered here.

And for all of this, we need you! If you believe in the Holy Order, if you are driven and skilled, then you may help us win this fight! Support our warships in their attacks, defend our position as we regain our strength. For the glory of the one true Pontifex!

We are at war. On multiple fronts. In this situation, a strong supply could make the difference between life and death. Blockades, famines, enemy contamination - a strong supply can help combat all of these things. Our stations require food for their workforces and civilian populations.

While we remain at war, we must ensure as best we can that our shipyards and equipment docks remain stocked with supplies that aid in the war effort. This will allow us to quicker and more efficiently build our fleets. We require transport pilots to deliver these supplies to us.

We have hired others to help build the large military installations that will be the mainstay of our defence in the fights to come, but we still require smaller defences in some areas. We would like laser towers built in more vulnerable areas in order to bolster our defences.

There are a number of areas from which the Godrealm of the Paranid may choose to strike. We have the opportunity to counter these strikes before they have even begun by laying a number of mines within Godrealm territory by the Gates through which they would strike. We require you to place some of these mines in one of these areas.

There is every possibility that we will not stop the Godrealm of the Paranid from entering our territory, but at the very least they can be slowed upon entering. As part of our defensive procedure, we request a number of mines to be deployed where the Godrealm may strike.

Against the Godrealm of the Paranid, our vital resources must be secured. We request that you place a number of defensive laser towers at strategic points in resource-heavy regions that are critical to our economy, to prolong or even halt enemy assaults on the territory.

Our strategists have given the directive that a single satellite be placed in an area of vital importance to our war effort against the Godrealm of the Paranid. The satellite is likely to be destroyed, but we will gather as much sensor data for the area as possible before it is, and we use the opportunity to gauge the Godrealm response.

Our watchers across our own space require more support from the satellite network that we have established over recent times. This grid allows us to track any potential threats to our space, as well as helping to track down spies and traitors to the cause. We require you to make sure this grid functions optimally.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Our watchers in Godrealm space require more support from the satellite network that we have established over the course of this conflict. The network allows us to better track enemy movements and gauge response times and methods, as well as keep our watchers safe. Please build a number of satellites to bolster this network.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Many ships have been damaged in the conflicts that we fight. Our shipyards are already working at full capacity to aid in the war effort, and ship crews have been encouraged to repair as many of the internal systems as they can. We require additional help to repair hull and external sub-systems.

A number of our watchers have returned to Holy Order space after extended operations in Godrealm territory. They require transport to the strategists at the front line to give direct reports that will aid the ware effort. We requrest a number of pilots to provide safe and swift passage for these war heroes.

Our strategists have given the directive that a new military installation is to be built in a location they have marked as key to deterring false Godrealm aggression. The facility must be built to the following specifications.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Much can be learned about the false Godrealm's future operations against us if we know what resources they have directly available to them. We need someone to scout out regions in Godrealm territory for high yields of: $WARENAMES$
(next ID reserved for gender)Assassinate Godrealm Agent

(ma target)A watcher belonging to the Godrealm of the Paranid has finally been given up by a colleague we caught some time ago. $NPCName$ has worked for weeks as an entrepreneur operating within our territory, secretly meeting with Godrealm sympathisers to have them work against us. We would like to see him dealt with.

(fe target)A watcher belonging to the Godrealm of the Paranid has finally been given up by a colleague we caught some time ago. $NPCName$ has worked for weeks as an entrepreneur operating within our territory, secretly meeting with Godrealm sympathisers to have them work against us. We would like to see her dealt with.
(ma target)\nHe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Destroy him.
(fe target)\nShe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Destroy her.

(ma target)During one of our last engagements with the Godrealm of the Paranid, we were able to capture one of their pilots. $NPCName$ has now escaped imprisonment and we believe he is attempting to make his way back to Godrealm space. It has been decided that we no longer need him alive, and we wish to stop him from reaching his final destination.

(fe target)During one of our last engagements with the Godrealm of the Paranid, we were able to capture one of their pilots. $NPCName$ has now escaped imprisonment and we believe she is attempting to make her way back to Godrealm space. It has been decided that we no longer need her alive, and we wish to stop her from reaching her final destination.
(ma target)\nHe is flying the ship: $SHIPID$. Remove him.
(fe target)\nShe is flying the ship: $SHIPID$. Remove her.

Collecting data from many battles, the strategists have concluded there is one Godrealm ship that we should prioritise for as a target. We believe that the ship may contain important battle strategies for the enemy. The ship must be engaged and boarded so that any data from the ship's board computer may be analysed. This may give us a key advantage in battles to come.
We are looking to push the false Godrealm fleet back out of the sector, and during the fight they will require support. Please deliver this in whichever way you can.

To greater improve our chances of striking back against the Godrealm heretics, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to take command of our ships. These pilots should be brought to one of our stations before the fighting starts.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

Our fleet is almost ready to fly and we now seek pilots that can pilot them to victory against the Godrealm apostates. $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) with the following skills should be brought to $DESTINATION$ before the fighting begins.\n$SKILLS$

To make sure our fleets and defensive installations are performing at maximum efficienty during the upcoming fights against the false Godrealm, we require $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) with the following skills to be brought to $DESTINATION$ for distribution.\n$SKILLS$

We cannot win this fight against the Godrealm without warships to carry out the one true Pontifex's will. Our shipyards already work at full capacity, and to bolster the fleet we require help from independent ship builders. To aid us in this matter, please bring the following ships to $SECTOR$:\n$FLEET$

During the course of the war against the Godrealm of the Paranid, one of our stations has been unable to keep up its supply. The situation may be salvaged by increasing the storage levels to the specified minimum threshold.\n\nMinimum storage level: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

(singular)From information gathered from a prisoner of war, we know that the false Godrealm is currently live-testing new ship specifications in the field. This supplies us with the opportunity to disrupt the enemy development strategy. Seek out a ship with the following specification and destroy it:\n$SPECS$

(plural)From information gathered from a prisoner of war, we know that the false Godrealm is currently live-testing new ship specifications in the field. This supplies us with the opportunity to disrup the enemy development strategy. Seek out ships with the following specification and destroy them:\$SPECS$

We suspect one of our agents has double-crossed us and is secretly working for the Godrealm of the Paranid. We cannot act without proof and if we send our forces after them, we may scare them off. We are looking for someone to deep-scan their ship for us. The information from this scan will help inform whether we have been betrayed. $PERCENT$

After the construction of a new station in their territory, the Godrealm of the Paranid are seeing a boom in their economy. It is highly unusual for a single station to have such an effect, and we wish to know what they have done to achieve it. Perhaps with this information, we can use the advantage for ourselves. You are required to provide us with a deep scan of the station. $PERCENT$

We require a skilled and trusted pilot for a potentially dangerous mission. We require information to be taken from a module on a high-security Godrealm station; a station we believe that in this moment is critical to the enemy war effort. Perform a deep scan of the module and send us the data you retrieve. We will analyse whether our efforts should be focused there. $MODULE$

The Godrealm of the Paranid have sunk so low as to send an agent into our space to distribute vial drugs throughout the population. It is a deliberate and disgusting attempt to destabilise us, and we will not stand for it. The identity of this Godrealm agent remains unknown - we will punish any found harbouring these wares. Scan ships in our space and report any that carry the following: $WARE$

It seems the Godrealm of the Paranid has sent a number of agents into our space to sell items we deem illegal to the populous. This is a disgusting attempt to destabilise the population and turn them against us. These criminals must be found! Scan ships and report any pilots who are caught carrying the following: $ITEM$

The Godrealm of the Paranid has set a dangerous individual upon us. They have been hiding within our territory and whispering propaganda into the population's ears, hoping to turn them against us. They must be stopped. We know where they were last seen - they must be found before they can leave the area. Find them and report their ship. We will do the rest: $PERSONNAME$

Our watchers have informed us that the Godrealm of the Paranid has allowed a vicious criminal to escape into our territory. We have not yet been able to locate the ship ourselves, though we know where it entered Holy Order space. We require a trusted agent to seek out the ship and report its location, so that our watchers may track its whereabouts: $IDCODE$

The weaklings of the Godrealm of the Paranid are continuously grasping at straws to gain any sort of meagre advantage over our righteous warriors. Recently, they have begun to outfit their engines and thrusters with unsanctified components, most likely in an attempt to outrace our superior warships in the event of their inevitable defeat. In response to this, one of the True Pontifex' most trusted Priest Kings is assembling a strike force to pierce the heart of their cowardly operation and show them the utter futility of their actions. To prepare for this glorious undertaking, you are required to venture deep into the heretics' territory and identify ships which carry Antimatter Converters.

Over the course of the war, an increasing number of our most distinguished warrior Triads have outdone themselves. In unparalleled displays of holy zeal, they have loaded their cargo bays with experimental missiles and plunged deep into enemy ranks. While the True Pontifex is inclined to commend these brave souls' initiative, several Priest Dukes have voiced the suspicion that the despicable admirals of the so-called Godrealm might be preparing to employ similar tactics against us. To verify these claims, you are commissioned to gather information on heretic ships which are carrying the Advanced Composites needed to fashion such explosives.
The false Godrealm is testing targeting modifications on a group of their laser towers. Destroy them before they gather enough useful data to improve their military infrastructure.

We put up a group of cheap laser towers with weak security systems to monitor the so-called Godrealm's hacking process. Now that we have gathered the data we were after, dispose of the taken-over laser towers.
The apostate Godrealm utilises military infrastructure to assert control over this area. We will not allow that.

page.title: Split vs ? War
page.descr: Texts for the 'Split vs ? war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: (next ID reserved for gender)Xxx Agent Uncovered
(ma target)\nHe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Remove him.
(fe target)\nShe was last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Remove her.

page.title: Improve Station Defences
page.t: After a recent review, our station defences have come under much criticism, especially given our proximity to such dangerous sectors. We have hired a specialist to help improve our existing defences as well as coordinate the deployment of new ones. We're looking for an experienced freelancer to join our team and aid the specialist in their tasks.

As you probably know, I have been hired to lead the overhaul of defences at a local station. Over the years I have worked on a great many engineering projects; from destroyers to wharfs, carriers to torpedos, I've seen it all! This should be a nice change of pace, assuming we don't get a Xenon fleet making a bee-line for us. Follow my lead and we'll turn this waste of hull plating into a fortified base in no time.

I don't think the manager of this station knows a spacefly from a warhead. It took me two mintues to boost the power grid in this lab by 30%. That's even 20% over the 'safety-limit', but I made it stick. Before I can even get started on the weapons, I see all sorts of improvements to be made but I'll need materials. Don't worry, I'll be sure to mark this all down in the invoice so we get reimbursed.

Outrageous! The manager of this station accuses us of blowing the budget on 'trivial and dangerous tweaks'. I got so angry that I've practically lost my voice! So, this is what we're going to do. I'm going to play their game and straighten out their turret barrels, while you go out and deploy a number of defensive laser towers, the cheap kind. We'll leave this place better than we found it, split the remaining funds and move on.
I'd say that's a job well done. Now, let's get out of here and get on with our lives. Best make it quick.

(ma specialist)Thank you for your honesty in this matter. This 'specialist' has been under investigation for some time and we drew the short straw on having him mess with our station. Thankfully, it seems to have paid off and he is now in custody. Rest assured, we would have intervened should you be coerced into doing something illegal. For now, take this as thanks.

(fe specialist)Thank you for your honesty in this matter. This 'specialist' has been under investigation for some time and we drew the short straw on having her mess with our station. Thankfully, it seems to have paid off and she is now in custody. Rest assured, we would have intervened should you be coerced into doing something illegal. For now, take this as thanks.
I'd call that a job well done. I've sent you the first payment but the remaining amount will have to wait until the transfer from the station is complete. I'll be in touch.

(ma specialist)Hello captain. I represent the station which was in need of defence improvements, some time ago. As you may have gathered, the specialist we hired was not as capable as he led on and has since been arrested on multiple counts including racketeering and reckless endangerment. Thankfully, no one was hurt and we can put the matter to rest.\nThe investigation has also cleared you of any wrongdoing, so we see fit to reimburse you with the originally agreed payment.

(fe specialist)Hello captain. I represent the station which was in need of defence improvements, some time ago. As you may have gathered, the specialist we hired was not as capable as he led on and has since been arrested on multiple counts including racketeering and reckless endangerment. Thankfully, no one was hurt and we can put the matter to rest.\nThe investigation has also cleared you of any wrongdoing, so we see fit to reimburse you with the originally agreed payment.

page.title: Venture Missions
page.descr: Text used to describe missions to other players' universes
page.t: (no return)The venture team has failed to return!
Encountered person of interest during venture!

The discovery of this warp anomaly and the research that properly allows us to make use of it opens up countless literal realms of possibility. Send a ship out on a peaceful mission to explore one of these parallel universes so that we may better understand them.

Now that we have unlocked the path to parallel universes, we can send out scout ships to explore them. In doing so we may learn more about its inhabitants as well as what binds our universes together.

There is a great deal more to be learned from rocks and gas than many would have you believe - doubly true when they come from a different universe. If we are able to learn the chemical composition of anything mining ships we send abroad bring back, it can only benefit us. Not only will they provide us with a shower of new scientific knowledge, but as long as the minerals and gases we find are close enough to what is required by refineries here, we stand to profit too.

I am willing to guarantee that intelligent life will always trade, in one way or another. Whether or not we load up a transporter here and send it across a different universe to sell its wares, or send it to another universe with the order to stock up there, I would bet that a trader of any skill could bring back some currency of worth to us. Travelling from station to station or planet to planet will also give us the opportunity to map out more of these parallel universes, and may even provide some very necessary diplomatic relations.

There is definitely potential to sending an empty trading ship out into the multi-verse. Risk too; we cannot guarantee that any other universe is willing to accept our currency, we cannot guarantee that our traders can bring anything back that we can sell here. However, the multi-verse is... big. Very big. I am willing to bet that somewhere out there, there is a place, person or organisation that will accept our credits in exchange for something at least close enough to one of our economy resources that it is useful. Now we just have to find them.

Trading between universes is complicated. I find there to be a reasonable chance, though still small in the grand scale of things, that if we fill a transporter with resources here and send it across the multiverse, someone, somewhere will want to buy what we are selling. There is significantly less of a chance that said individual or organisation can give us something of worth in return, but in such situations we must trust in traders of all skill levels to be able to negotiate properly. What else are travelling salesmen for?

We have a good understanding of how dangerous and troublesome the Xenon are, having been almost constantly reminded of the threat they pose for several centuries, at this point. It is an almost mathematical certainty that someone in another universe made the same mistake as the Terrans once did, and so I am confident that we can find Xenon in other universes than our own. Sending pilots out on patrols against them could prove good combat practice for your pilots, and is almost a diplomatic service to those inhabiting these universes.

If we can seek out a universe in which there is intelligent life and a legal system, then it is almost certain that we will find piracy too. Perhaps we can lend a helping hand here; send pilots out to patrol against these pirates - not only will it help the other universes that we come across, but is also likely to be lucrative for us. I am sure local authorities will be pleased by our work, and of course we can keep whatever we can scavenge from wrecked or abandoned pirate ships.

If so inclined, you can seek out ships belonging to multi-verse equivalents of the factions present in our version of the Jump Gate network, to... negotiate with them, aggressively. It would give your pilots combat experience, with little consequence for us here, and of course comes with the chance of salvage. Do take caution though. I'm sure that any faction you choose to measure yourself against in a parallel universe would react just as unhappily to an attack as any of ours, and of course, should anyone have developed the same technology as us, we could open ourselves to retaliation.

With a countless number of universes at our doorstep, it is quite probable to run across someone else who has developed or discovered the same technology as us. They may be friend or foe, and will probably treat us the same way we treat them. And so, if you wish to make a name for yourself in the multi-verse, you can send ships out to target these individuals, and reap the benefits of doing so. Just bear in mind that with this technology, we may open ourselves up to counter-strike from them, and possibly their allies.

There are many things in this life better than conflict, but should you feel the need to train your combat pilots in an environment where they cannot possibly fall into trouble with our authorities, you can of course send them to other universes to target combat ships there instead. Naturally, this comes with its own risks; I am sure the entire multi-verse has access to equally skilled pilots, and there is a chance that one of your ships returns damaged, or does not return at all.

Though I don't usually condone violence, there are two advantages to targeting the transport vessels of other universes. Firstly, it disrupts economies; giving us a distinct advantage in any multiverse-wide conflict that might break out as a result of multiple universes having access to this technology. Secondly, it may give us the opportunity to study both the wares used in these universes, and the effect of cross-universe travel on these wares. If you do take this approach, do be careful however. I doubt local authorities will be too happy about this kind of behaviour.

During my captivity, I was often told that there is no greater show of force, of how far one is willing to go, than to target civilian ships. Split are rather barbaric, but it is a good point. Unable to defend themselves, I am sure if we were to target civilians of other universes, we would eventually be able to find something of worth to bring back to our own universe. Of course, we would not be breaking any of our own laws, but I must believe that authorities in these universes would not look kindly on such an attack.

My mind goes once again to the inevitability of conflict between universes, should more than one unlock the secrets of this technology. If we need an advantage in such a conflict, there is none greater than targeting the mining ships that fuel their economies. This slows down the production of combat ships that can be used against us, as well as affording us the opportunity to retrieve any resources they were collecting for ourselves. Of course, this could come at a great cost for our own pilots; should they be caught I fear the consequences would be rather dire.
